section.section_title: The servant is dependent on his Lord

sub_title.duay_title: The servant is dependent on his Lord #1
sub_title.duay: All human beings depend on Allah for their welfare and prevention of evil in various matters of their religion and world. Allah says (interpretation of the meaning): O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

sub_title.duay_title: The servant is dependent on his Lord #2
sub_title.duay: Prophet (ﷺ) used to say after every compulsory prayer, The servant will ask his Lord for all of his religiously and worldly needs, because the treasure of all things is in the hands of Allah. Allah says (interpretation of the meaning): “And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.” (Sura Al-Hijr 15:21) No one can withhold what Allah gives; And, no one can give what he resists.
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، اَللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha illallahu wahdahu laa sharika lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in qadir. Allaahumma laa maani'a limaa a'taita wa laa mu'tia limaa mana'ta wa laa yanfa'u dhal-jaddi minka al-jaddu
sub_title.translation: There is none worthy of worship except Allah alone with no partner or associate. He is the Dominion and to Him be all praise, and He is able to do all things. O Allah, one can withhold what You have given and none can give what You have withheld, and no wealth or fortune can benefit anyone for from You comes all wealth and fortune.

sub_title.duay_title: The reward of freeing of a slave
sub_title.duay: Say the following statement 10 times -
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilahaa illAllahu wahdahu laa sharika lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in qadir
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The person who says the above statement 10 times It would be as if he had freed four of Ishmael's (As) children from slavery.

section.section_title: The most important thing to ask Allah for

sub_title.duay_arbi: إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَإِيَّاكَ نَسْتَعِينُ
sub_title.transliteration: Iyyaaka na'budu wa lyyaaka nasta'een
sub_title.translation: It is You we worship and It is You we ask for help.
sub_title.duay_hadis: He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide. (Surah Al-Kahf 18:17)

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commenced the prayer when he got up at night. Then he said:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اِهْدِنِي لِمَا اخْتُلِفَ فِيهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِإِذْنِكَ إِنَّكَ تَهْدِي مَنْ تَشَاءُ إِلَى صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيْمٍ
sub_title.transliteration: Ihdini limakhtulifa fihi minal-haqqi bi'idhnika innaka tahdi man tasha'u ila siratim mustaqim
sub_title.translation: Guide me through that which there has been difference concerning the truth, verily, You are upon a straight path.

sub_title.duay: Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded Mu'adh bin Jabal (RA) to recite this supplication after every (prescribed) prayer -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّيْ عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ وَشُكْرِكَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'a'innee 'alaa thikrika, wa shukrika, wahusni 'ibaadatik
sub_title.translation: O Allah, help me to remember You, to give You thanks, and to perform Your worship in the best manner.

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commenced the prayer when he got up at night. Here is a part of it -
sub_title.duay_arbi: وَاهْدِنِيْ لِأَحْسَنِ الْأَخْلَاقِ لَا يَهْدِيْ لِأَحْسَنِهَا إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَاصْرِفْ عَنِّي سَيِّئَهَا لَا يَصْرِفُ عَنِّي سَيِّئَهَا إِلَّا أَنْتَ
sub_title.transliteration: Wahdini li ahsanil-akhlaaqi, la yahdi li ahsanihaa illa anta wasrif anni sayyi'ahaa laa yasrifu anni sayyi'ahaa illa anta
sub_title.translation: Guide me to the best of manners for none can guide to the best of them but You. Protect me from bad manners for none can protect against them but You.

sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) instructed Ali ibn Abi Talib (RA) to seek guidance and firmness from Allah -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدَى وَالسَّدَادَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as'alukal huda was-sadaad
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I beg of Thee righteousness and adhering to the straight path.

sub_title.duay: Narrated Al-Hasan ibn Ali (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) taught me some words that I say during the witr -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اهْدِنِيْ فِيمَنْ هَدَيْتَ وَعَافِنِي فِيمَنْ عَافَيْتَ وَتَوَلَّنِيْ فِيمَنْ تَوَلَّيْتَ وَبَارِكْ لِي فِيمَا أَعْطَيْتَ وَقِنِي شَرَّ مَا قَضَيْتَ فَإِنَّكَ تَقْضِي وَلَا يُقْضَى عَلَيْكَ إِنَّهُ لَا يَذِلُّ مَنْ وَالَيْتَ وَلَا يَعِزُّ مَنْ عَادَيْتَ تَبَارَكْتَ رَبَّنَا وَتَعَالَيْتَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-mahdinee feeman hadayta, wa 'aafinee feeman 'aafayta, wa tawallanee feeman tawallayta, wa baarik lee feemaa 'a'atayta, wa qinee sharra maa qadhayta, fa'innaka taqdhee wa laa yuqdhaa 'alayka, 'innahu laa yadhillu man waalayta, wa laa ya 'izzu man 'aadayta, tabaarakta Rabbanaa wa ta'aalayta
sub_title.translation: O Allah, guide me with those whom You have guided, and strengthen me with those whom You have given strength. Take me to Your care with those whom You have taken to Your care. Bless me in what You have given me. Protect me from the evil You have ordained. Surely, You command and are not commanded, and none whom You have committed to Your care shall be humiliated and none whom You have taken as an enemy shall taste glory. You are Blessed, Our Lord, and Exalted.

sub_title.duay: Forgiveness for sins should be sought from Allah, for the most important thing a servant can ask his Lord for, is forgiveness for his sins or its inevitable consequence. Such as deliverance from Hell and entry into Paradise. The servant needs forgiveness from his Lord for his sins, because he makes mistakes every day and night and Allah alone can forgive all sins. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: My heart is invaded by unmindfulness, and I ask Allah's pardon a hundred times in the day.
Narrated Abdullah ibn Umar (RA): We counted that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would say this dua a hundred times during a meeting -
sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَتُبْ عَلَىَّ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيْمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Rabbighfirli wa tub `alayya innaka Antat-Tawwabur-Rahim
sub_title.translation: O Allah forgive me and accept my repentance, for You are the Accepter of repentance, the Most Merciful.

sub_title.duay: Sahih (Albani). Abu Dawud: 1516
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الْعَظِيمَ الَّذِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّوْمُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Rabbighfirli wa tub `alayya innaka Antat-Tawwabur-Rahim
sub_title.translation: I seek the forgiveness of Allah the Mighty, Whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Living, the Eternal, and I repent to Him.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, Whoever says, 'I seek forgiveness from Allah, the Exalted, there is no god but He, the Ever-Living, the Everlasting, and I repent to Him', is forgiven even if he flees from the battlefield.

section.section_title: Ask for paradise & protection from fire

sub_title.duay_title: Ask for paradise & seek refuge from fire
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-jannata wa 'a'oodhu bika minan-naar
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and seek Your protection from the Fire.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), asked a man, What do you supplicate in your prayer? The man says, I recite Tashahhud and say- (The dua is mentioned above) I can’t recite dua as beautifully as you, nor can I recite dua like Mu'adh! Then Prophet (ﷺ) said, “We also supplicate like you!”

sub_title.duay_title: Seeking good of this world and the hereafter
sub_title.duay: Al-`Abbas bin `Abdul-Muttalib (RA) said: “I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), teach me something that I may ask Allah, [Mighty and Sublime] for.’ He (ﷺ) said: ‘Ask Allah for Al-`Āfiyah.’ Then I remained for a day, then I came and said: ‘O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), teach me something that I may ask Allah for.’ So he (ﷺ) said to me: “O Abbas, O uncle of the Messenger of Allah! Ask Allah for Al-`Āfiyah in the world and in the Hereafter.” [1] Narrated by Abu Bakr Siddiq (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said (sitting) on the pulpit, 'Seek forgiveness and healing from Allah, for no one has been given anything better than healing after Yaqeen.' [2]

section.section_title: Dua to remain steadfast on the religion

sub_title.duay_title: To get Stability in religion and good results in all deeds
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ مُصَرِّفَ الْقُلُوبِ صَرِّفْ قُلُوبَنَا عَلَى طَاعَتِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma musarrifal-qulubi, sarrif qulubana 'ala ta'atik
sub_title.translation: O Allah! Controller of the hearts, direct our hearts to Your obedience.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdullah bin Amr bin al-'As (RA) reported that he heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying: Verily, the hearts of all the sons of Adam are between the two fingers out of the fingers of the Compassionate Lord as one heart. He turns that to any (direction) He likes. Then Allah’s Messenger (ﷺ) said: (Dua mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to remain steadfast on the religion
sub_title.duay: Shahr bin Hawshab (R) said: “I said to Umm Salamah (RA): ‘O Mother of the Believers! What was the supplication that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said most frequently when he was with you?” She said: ‘The supplication he said most frequently was -
sub_title.duay_arbi: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِيْ عَلَى دِيْنِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Ya Muqallibal-qulubi, thabbit qalbi 'ala dinik
sub_title.translation: O Changer of the Hearts! Strengthen my heart upon Your Religion..
sub_title.duay_hadis: So I said: O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), why do you supplicate so frequently. He said: ‘O Umm Salamah! Verily, there is no human being except that his heart is between Two Fingers of the Fingers of Allah, so whomsoever He wills He makes steadfast, and whomever He wills He causes to deviate.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to remain steadfast on Islam
sub_title.duay_arbi: يَا وَلِيَّ الْإِسْلَامِ وَأَهْلِهُ ثَبِّتْنِيْ بِهِ حَتّٰى أَلْقَاكَ.
sub_title.transliteration: Yaa waliyyal islaami wa ahlihu thabbitni bihi hatta alqaaka.
sub_title.translation: O guardian of Islam and Muslims, keep me steadfast on Islam till the day when I will have the good fortune to meet you.
sub_title.reference: SProved on the basis of all sanads (Albani). Silsilatus Sahihah 1823

section.section_title: Dua of good outcome in all deeds

sub_title.duay_title: Good results and protection in all activities
sub_title.duay: Narrated Busar Ibn Artaa (RA): I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) reciting supplications like this -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَحْسِنْ عَاقِبَتَنَا فِي الْأُمُورِ كُلِّهَا وَأَجِرْنَا مِنْ خِزْيِ الدُّنْيَا وَعَذَابِ الْآَخِرَةِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma a'hsin ‘aaqibatanaa fil umuri kullihaa wa ajirna min khiz-yid dunya wa ‘adhaabil akhirah
sub_title.translation: O Allah! grant us a good outcome on all of our affairs and save us from the disgrace of this world and the punishment of the Hereafter.

section.section_title: Seeking whatever good Allah can bestow

sub_title.duay_title: Seeking good of this world and the hereafter #1
sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَصْلِحْ لِي دِينِيَ الَّذِي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي دُنْيَايَ الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَاشِي، وَأَصْلِحْ لِي آخِرَتِي الَّتِي فِيهَا مَعَادِي، وَاجْعَلِ الْحَيَاةَ زِيَادَةً لِي فِي كُلِّ خَيْرٍ، وَاجْعَلِ الْمَوْتَ رَاحَةً لِي مِنْ كُلِّ شَرٍّ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma aslih lee deeni alladhi huwa ‛is-matu amree, Wa aslih lee dun-yaaiallati feeha ma‛aashee, Wa asli lee aakhiratee allati feeha ma‛aadee, Waj-‛alil hayaata ziyaa‛datan lee fee kulli khair waj 'alilmawta raa‛hatan lee min kulli sharr
sub_title.translation: O Allah perfect for me my religion on which success of all my affairs depends, And perfect my worldly affairs on which my livelihood depends, And perfect my hereafter to which I will return, And make in life for me an increase of all good, And make death for me a comfort from all evil.

sub_title.duay_title: Seeking good of this world and the hereafter #2
sub_title.duay: Narrated Abdullah bin Umar (RA): One of the supplications of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was as follows -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ زَوَالِ نِعْمَتِكَ وَتَحَوُّلِ عَافِيَتِكَ وَفُجَاءَةِ نِقْمَتِكَ وَجَمِيعِ سَخَطِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma in-nee a‛oodhu bika min za-waali ni‛matik, wa tahaw-wuli ‛aafi-yatik, wa fujaa-ati niqmatik, wa jamee‛i sakha-tik
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from deprivation of Your blessing, alteration of Your protection, sudden infliction of Your anger, and all Your wrath.

section.section_title: Shelter from horror, misery, evil consequences and rejoicing of the enemy

sub_title.duay_title: Shelter from evil consequences and rejoicing of the enemy
sub_title.duay: Narrated Abu Huraira (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to seek refuge with Allah from the difficult moment of a calamity and from being overtaken by destruction and from being destined to an evil end, and from the malicious joy of enemies.
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ، وَالْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ، وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْجُبْنِ، وَضَلَعِ الدَّيْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ الرِّجَالِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'A'oodhu bika minal-hammi wal-hazani, wal'ajzi wal-kasali, wal-bukhli wal-jubni, wa dhala'id-dayni wa ghalabatir-rijaal
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in you from grief and sadness, from weakness and from laziness, from miserliness and from cowardice, from being overcome by debt and overpowered by men (i.e. others).

section.section_title: Times and places when dua will be accepted

sub_title.duay: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Amr ibn al-'As (RA): A man said: O Messenger of Allah, the mu'adhdhins excel us. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Say (the same words) as they say, and when you come to the end, ask Allah for anything and that will be granted to you.
Anas (RA) said, the Prophet (ﷺ) said, when the call to prayer (adhan) is given, the gates of heaven are opened and the dua is accepted.
Allah (SWT) says -
sub_title.duay_arbi: إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ ﴿١﴾ وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ ﴿٢﴾ لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ ﴿٣﴾ تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمْرٍ ﴿٤﴾ سَلَامٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ الْفَجْرِ ﴿٥﴾
sub_title.translation: (1) Indeed, We sent the Qur'an down during the Night of Decree. (2) And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree? (3) The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months. (4) The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter. (5) Peace it is until the emergence of dawn.

sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to 'Aa'ishah (RA): You say -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ عَفُوٌّ كَرِيمٌ تُحِبُّ الْعَفْوَ فَاعْفُ عَنِّي
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innaka 'afuwwun karim, tuhibbul-'afwa, fa'fu 'anni
sub_title.translation: O Allah, You are Most Forgiving, Generous. You love forgiveness; so forgive me.

sub_title.duay: Regarding when the Dua is accepted, the Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'On the last night and after the obligatory prayers.'

sub_title.duay_title: Dua at the last part of the night
sub_title.duay: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'Our Lord, the Blessed, the Superior, comes every night down on the nearest Heaven to us when the last third of the night remains, saying: 'Is there anyone to invoke Me, so that I may respond to invocation? Is there anyone to ask Me, so that I may grant him his request? Is there anyone seeking My forgiveness, so that I may forgive him?' [1]
sub_title.duay_arbi: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ ﴿١٧﴾ وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ﴿١٨﴾
sub_title.translation: (17) They used to sleep but little of the night, (18) And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness. [2]

sub_title.duay_title: Dua at the time between Adhan and Iqamah
sub_title.duay: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Dua at the time between Adhan and Iqamah is not returned.

sub_title.duay_title: Time to accept prayers (during Adhan, Iqamah, Raining and War)
sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Two (prayers) are not rejected, or seldom rejected: Prayer at the time of the call to prayer, and (the prayer) at the time of fighting when it's intensified. Another narration says, 'when it's raining.'

sub_title.duay_title: Dua at a specific time in every night
sub_title.duay: Jabir (RA) said he heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say: There is an hour during the night in which no Muslim individual will ask Allah for good in this world and the next without His giving it to him; and that applies to every night.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua when drinking Zamzam water with pure intention
sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: ‘The water of Zamzam is for whatever it is drunk for.’

sub_title.duay_title: Dua in the state of prostration
sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: The nearest a servant comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating himself, so make supplication (in this state).

sub_title.duay_title: After awaking at night, reciting some specific duas
sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The person who wakes up at night and says these words -
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ‏ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَلَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha illAllahu Wa'hdahu laa Sharika lahu Lahul mulku, wa lahul-'hamd wa huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadir. Al'hamdulillahi wa sub'hanallahi wa laa ilaaha illAllahu wAllahu akbar wa laa 'hawla Walaa Quwwata illa billaah
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah. He is the Only One and has no partners. For Him is the Kingdom and all the praises are due for Him. He is Omnipotent. All the praises are for Allah. All the glories are for Allah. And none has the right to be worshipped but Allah, And Allah is Great And there is neither Might nor Power Except with Allah.
sub_title.duay_hadis: O Allah! Forgive me. Or invokes (Allah), he will be responded to and if he performs ablution (and prays), his prayer will be accepted.

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Yunus (As) prayed while he was in the belly of a fish -
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِيْنَ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta sub'haanaka 'innee kuntu minadh-dhaalimeen
sub_title.translation: There is none worthy of worship but You, glory is to You. Surely, I was among the wrongdoers.
sub_title.duay_hadis: So indeed, no Muslim man supplicates with it for anything, ever, except Allah responds to him.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua for one who afflicted by a calamity
sub_title.duay: If any slave of Allah supplicate when he afflicted with a calamity -
sub_title.duay_arbi: إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُوْنَ، اَللَّهُمَّ أْجُرْنِيْ فِي مُصِيْبَتِيْ وَأَخْلِفْ لِي خَيْرًا مِّنْهَا
sub_title.transliteration: Innaa lillaahi wa 'innaa 'ilayhi raaji'oon, Allaahumma'-jurni fee museebatee wa 'akhliflee khayran minhaa
sub_title.translation: We are from Allah and unto Him we return. O Allah take me out of my plight and bring to me after it something better.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Umm Salama (RA) reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying: If any Muslim who suffers some calamity says, what Allah has commanded him - (The dua is mentioned above) Allah will give him something better than it in exchange.

sub_title.duay: Umm Salama (RA) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came to Abu Salama (as he died). His eyes were fixedly open. He closed them, and then said: When the soul is taken away the sight follows it. Some of the people of his family wept and wailed. So he said: Do not supplicate for yourselves anything but good, for angels say'Amen' to what you say.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua at the begining of the prayer #1
sub_title.duay: While praying with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), one of the people said -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيْرًا وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيْرًا وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيْلًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu 'Akbar Kabiran, walhamdu lillaahi kathiran, wa Subhaanallahi bukratan wa'asila
sub_title.translation: Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Glory is to Allah, at the break of day and at its end.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, 'Who uttered such and such a word?' A person (who have recited these words) among the people said: It is I, O Messenger of Allah! He (ﷺ) said: it’s utterance surprised me, for the doors of heaven were opened for It. Ibn 'Umar (RA) said: I have not abandoned them (these words) since I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying this.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua at the begining of the prayer #2
sub_title.duay: Anas (RA) reported: A man came panting and entered the row of worshippers and said:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ حَمْدًا كَثِيْرًا طَيِّبًا مُبَارَكًا فِيهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdulillaahi hamdan kathiran tayyiban mubaarakan fih
sub_title.translation: Praise is to Allah, much, good and blessed praise.
sub_title.duay_hadis: When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) finished the prayer he said: Who amongst you uttered these words? The people remained silent. He (the Prophet ﷺ again said) : Who amongst you uttered these words? He said nothing wrong. Then a man said: I came and had a difficulty in breathing, so I uttered them. He replied: I saw twelve angels facing one another as to who will take them up (to Allah).

sub_title.duay_title: While reciting Surah Fatiha behind the Imam
sub_title.duay: Abu Huraira (RA) reported: The Apostle of Allah (ﷺ) said: If anyone observes prayer in which he does not recite Umm al-Qur'an, It is deficient [he said this three times] and not complete. It was said to Abu Huraira (RA): At times we are behind the Imam. He said: Recite it inwardly, for he had heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) declare that Allah the Exalted had said: I have divided the prayer into two halves between Me and My servant, and My servant will receive what he asks. When the servant says: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the universe, Allah the Most High says: My servant has praised Me. And when he (the servant) says: The Most Compassionate, the Merciful, Allah the Most High says: My servant has lauded Me. And when he (the servant) says: Master of the Day of judgment, He remarks: My servant has glorified Me. and sometimes He would say: My servant entrusted (his affairs) to Me. And when he (the worshipper) says: Thee do we worship and of Thee do we ask help, He (Allah) says: This is between Me and My servant, and My servant will receive what he asks for. Then, when he (the worshipper) says: Guide us to the straight path, the path of those to whom Thou hast been Gracious not of those who have incurred Thy displeasure, nor of those who have gone astray, He (Allah) says: This is for My servant, and My servant will receive what he asks for.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua after getting up from the rukoo
sub_title.duay: One day we were praying behind the Prophet (ﷺ). When he raised his head from bowing, he said, 'Sami'Allah Huliman 'Hamidah' A man behind him said -
sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، حَمْدًا كَثِيْرًا طَيِّبًا مُبَارَكًا فِيهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Rabbanaa wa lakal-hamd, hamdan katheeran tayyiban mubaarakan feeh
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, praise is Yours, abundant, good and blessed praise.
sub_title.duay_hadis: When the Prophet (ﷺ) completed the prayer, he asked, 'Who has said these words?' The man replied, 'I.' The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'I saw over thirty angels competing to write it first.'

sub_title.duay_title: If the Amin of any one coincides with that of the angels
sub_title.duay: Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Say Amin' when the Imam says it and if the Amin of any one of you coincides with that of the angels then all his past sins will be forgiven.' [1] Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'Say Amen' when the Imam says 'Ghairil maghdubi 'alaihim walad daalleen' (not the path of those who earn Your Anger (such as Jews) nor of those who go astray (such as Christians); all the past sins of the person whose saying (Amin) coincides with that of the angels, will be forgiven'. [2]
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, 'When the Imam says, 'Sami'Allahu liman hamidah' you should say -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabbanaa wa lakal-hamd
sub_title.translation: O Allah, our Lord and to You be the praise.
sub_title.duay_hadis: If the saying of any one of you coincides with that of the angels, all his past sins will be forgiven.

sub_title.duay: Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) entered the mosque. Then a person is reciting Tashahhud towards the end of the prayer. He said -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ يَا اللَّهُ بِأَنَّكَ الْوَاحِدُ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ الَّذِي لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ أَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِي ذُنُوبِي إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as'aluka ya Allahu bi annakal Wahidul-Ahad us-Samadulla-dhi lam yalid wa lam yowlad, wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan ahad, an taghfirali dhunubi, innaka antal-Ghafurur-Rahim
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask of You, O Allah, as You are the One, the Only, the Self-Sufficient Master, Who begets not nor was He begotten, and there is None equal or comparable to Him, forgive me my sins, for You are the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'He has been forgiven,' three times.

sub_title.duay: A man was praying. He did ruku’, sajdah and supplicate after tashahhud -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ الْمَنَّانُ بَدِيعُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّوْمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as'aluka bi-anna lakal-hamdu, laa ilaaha illaa antal-mannanu badi'us-samawaati wal-ardi, yaa dhal-jalaali wal-ikraam! Yaa hayyu yaa qayyum
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask Thee by virtue of the fact that praise is due to Thee, there is no deity but Thou, Who showest favour and beneficence, the Originator of the Heavens and the earth, O Lord of Majesty and Splendour, O Living One, O Eternal One.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Do you know what he has supplicated with?' They said: 'Allah (SWT) and His Messenger (ﷺ) know best.'He said: 'By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, he called upon Allah by His greatest Name, which, if He is called by it, He responds, and if He is asked by it, He gives.'

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) heard a man saying -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنِّي أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ اَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ الَّذِيْ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُوْلَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka bi 'anni 'ash-hadu 'annaka 'AntAllahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Antal-'Ahadus-Samadul-ladhee lam yalid wa lam yoolad wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'Ahad
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You, by the fact that I bear witness that You are Allah. There is none worthy of worship but You, the Only God, Independent of creation, who was not begotten and begets not, and none is equal to Him.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, he called upon Allah by His greatest Name, which, if He is called by it, He responds, and if He is asked by it, He gives.'

sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If any one of you performs ablution and performs it properly, then he says -
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Ash-hadu an laa ilaaha ill-Allahu wahdahu laa sharika lahu, wa ash hadu anna Muhammadan ‘abduhu wa Rasooluhu
sub_title.translation: I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad (ﷺ) is His slave and His Messenger.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The eight gates of Paradise will be opened for him; He will enter (Paradise) through whichever door he wishes.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua in the day of ‘Arafah at ‘Arafat
sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The best supplication is the supplication on the day of 'Arafah. The best dua that the Prophet (ﷺ) recited is -
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيءٍ قَدِيرٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha ill-Allahu, wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa huwa ‛alaa kulli shay’in qadeer
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshiped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs sovereignty and all praise and He is over all things omnipotent.

sub_title.duay: Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When you hear the crowing of rooster, ask for Allah's Blessings for (their crowing indicates that) they have seen an angel. And when you hear the braying of donkeys, seek Refuge with Allah from Satan for (their braying indicates) that they have seen a Satan

sub_title.duay_title: When the heart is devoted to Allah
sub_title.duay: This concept is included in the hadith of the inhabitants of the cave. Because each of them mentioned one of their good deeds which they did only for Allah and to get close to him. So, when they were supplicating by their good deed, Allah responded to them.

sub_title.duay_title: Ten days of the month of Dhul Hijjah
sub_title.duay: Narrated by Ibn `Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'No good deeds done on other days are superior to those done on these (first ten days of Dhul Hijja).' Then some companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Not even Jihad?' He replied, 'Not even Jihad, except that of a man who does it by putting himself and his property in danger (for Allah's sake) and does not return with any of those things.

section.section_title: Excellence of dua in the morning & evening

sub_title.duay_title: Excellence of dua in the morning & evening
sub_title.duay: Anas (RA) said that he heard the Prophet (SAW) say: That I sit with people remembering Almighty Allah from the morning (Fajr) prayer until sunrise is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves from among the Children of Isma'il. That I sit with people remembering Allah from the afternoon ('Asr) prayer until the sun sets is more beloved to me than freeing four slaves from among the Children of Isma'il.
This Dua should be recited when the sun rises:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِيْ أَقَالَنَا يَوْمَنَا هٰذَا وَلَمْ يُهْلِكْنَا بِذُنُوْبِنَا
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil-ladhi aqaalanaa yawmanaa hadhaa wa-lam yuh-liknaa bi-dhunubinaa
sub_title.translation: All praise (and innumerable thanks) to Allah, Who has shown us this day, and did not destroy us for our (past) sins.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَذَا الْيَوْمِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوْءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
sub_title.transliteration: Asbahnaa wa 'asbahal-mulku lillaahi walhamdu lillaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer. Rabbi 'as'aluka khayra maa fee haathal-yawmi wa khayra maa ba'dahu wa 'A'oodhu bika min sharri maa fee haathal-yawmi wa sharri maa ba'dahu, Rabbi 'A'oodhu bika minal-kasali, wa soo'il-kibari, Rabbi 'A'oodhu bika min 'athaabin fin-naari wa 'athaabin fil-qabr.
sub_title.translation: We have reached the morning and at this very time unto Allah, belongs all sovereignty, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. My Lord, I ask You for the good of this day and the good of what follows it and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil of what follows it. My Lord, I take refuge in You from laziness and senility. My Lord, I take refuge in You from torment in the Fire and punishment in the grave.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma bika 'asbahnaa, wa bika 'amsaynaa, wa bika nahyaa, wa bika namootu wa 'ilaykan-nushoor.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, by You we enter the morning and by You we enter the evening, by You we live and and by You we die, and to You is our resurrection.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ، اَللَّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَا الْيَوْمِ فَتْحَهُ، وَنَصْرَهُ، وَنُورَهُ، وَبَرَكَتَهُ، وَهُدَاهُ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيهِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Asbahnaa wa 'asbahal-mulku lillaahi Rabbil-'aalameen, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayra haathal-yawmi, Fathahu wa nasrahu wa noorahu, wa barakatahu, wa hudaahu, wa'A'oodhu bika min sharri maafeehi wa sharri maa ba'dahu.
sub_title.translation: We have reached the morning and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. O Allah, I ask You for the good of this day, its triumphs and its victories, its light and its blessings and its guidance, and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil that follows it.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَصْبَحْنَا عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الْإِسْلَامِ، وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الْإِخْلَاصِ، وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ، وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ، حَنِيفًا مُسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
sub_title.transliteration: Asbahnaa 'alaa fitratil-'Islaami wa 'alaa kalimatil-'ikhlaasi, wa 'alaa deeni Nabiyyinaa Muhammadin (ﷺ), wa 'alaa millati 'abeenaa 'Ibraaheema, haneefan Musliman wa maa kaana minal-mushrikeen.
sub_title.translation: We rise in the morning upon the fitrah of Islaam, and the word of pure faith, and upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad and the religion of our forefather Ibraaheem, who was a Muslim and of true faith and was not of those who associate others with Allah.

sub_title.duay: Say this dua four times in the morning:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَصْبَحْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلَائِكَتِكَ، وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'asbahtu 'ush-hiduka wa 'ush-hidu hamalata 'arshika, wa malaa'ikatika wajamee'a khalqika, 'annaka 'AntAllahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa Rasooluka.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, verily I have reached the morning and call on You, the bearers of Your throne, Your angels, and all of Your creation to witness that You are Allah, none has the right to be worshipped except You, alone, without any partner and that Muhammad is Your Servant and Messenger.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma maa 'asbaha bee min ni'matin 'aw bi'ahadin min khalqika faminka wa'hdaka laa shareeka laka, falakal-'hamdu wa lakash-shukru.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, what blessing I have received in this morning or any of Your creation, is from You alone, without any partner, so for You is all praise and unto You all thanks.

sub_title.duay: Say three times -
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ عَدَدَ خَلْقِهِ وَرِضَى نَفْسِهِ وَزِنَةَ عَرْشِهِ وَمِدَادَ كَلِمَاتِهِ
sub_title.transliteration: SubhaanAllahi wa bihamdihi, 'Adada khalqihi, wa ridhaa nafsihi, wa zinata 'arshihi wa midaada kalimaatihi.
sub_title.translation: How perfect Allah is! I praise Him by the number of His creation and His pleasure, and by the weight of His throne, and the ink of His words
sub_title.duay_hadis: Juwairiya reported that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came out from (her apartment) in the morning as she was busy in observing her dawn prayer in her place of worship. He came back in the forenoon and she was still sitting there. He (the Holy Prophet) said to her: You have been in the same seat since I left you. She said: Yes. Thereupon Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) said: I recited four words (above mentioned words) three times after I left you and if these are to be weighed against what you have recited since morning these would outweigh them.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَمْسَيْنَا عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الْإِسْلَامِ، وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الْإِخْلَاصِ، وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ، حَنِيفًا مُسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
sub_title.transliteration: Amsaynaa 'alaa fitratil-'Islaami wa 'alaa kalimatil-'ikhlaasi, wa 'alaa deeni Nabiyyinaa Muhammadin, wa 'alaa millati 'abeenaa 'Ibraaheema, haneefan Musliman wa maa kaana minal-mushrikeen.
sub_title.translation: We rise in the evening upon the fitrah of Islaam, and the word of pure faith, and upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad and the religion of our forefather Ibraaheem, who was a Muslim and of true faith and was not of those who associate others with Allah.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَمْسَيْنَا وَأَمْسَا الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوْءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
sub_title.transliteration: Amsaynaa wa'amsal-mulku lillaahi walhamdu lillaahi, laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer. Rabbi 'as'aluka khayra maa fee haathihil-laylati wa khayra maa ba'daha wa 'A'oodhu bika min sharri maa fee haathihil-laylati wa sharri maa ba'daha, Rabbi 'A'oodhu bika minal-kasali, wa soo'il-kibari, Rabbi 'A'oodhu bika min 'athaabin fin-naari wa 'athaabin fil-qabr.
sub_title.translation: We have reached the evening and at this very time unto Allah, belongs all sovereignty, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. My Lord, I ask You for the good of this night and the good of what follows it and I take refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil of what follows it. My Lord, I take refuge in You from laziness and senility. My Lord, I take refuge in You from torment in the Fire and punishment in the grave.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdullah ibn Masood (RA) said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) recited the above-mentioned dua in every morning and evening. In the morning he recites Asba’hna.…. and in the evening he recites Amsa-aia instead of Asba’hna.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma bika 'amsaynaa, wa bika 'asbahnaa, wa bika nahyaa, wa bika namootu wa 'ilaykal-maseer.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, by You we enter the evening and by You we enter the morning, by You we live and and by You we die, and to You is our resurrection

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَمْسَيْنَا وَأَمْسَا الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ، اللَّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ :فَتْحَهَا، وَنَصْرَهَا، وَنُورَهَا، وَبَرَكَتَهَا، وَهُدَاهَا، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِيهَا وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا
sub_title.transliteration: Amsaynaa wa 'amsal-mulku lillaahi Rabbil-'aalameen, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka khayra haadhi hil-laylati, Fathahaa wa nasrahaa wa noorahaa, wa barakatahaa, wa hudaahaa, wa'A'oodhu bika min sharri maa feehaa wa sharri maa ba'dahaa.
sub_title.translation: We have reached the evening and at this very time all sovereignty belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds. O Allah, I ask You for the good of this day, its triumphs and its victories, its light and its blessings and its guidance, and I take refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil that follows it.

sub_title.duay: Say this dua four times in the evening:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَمْسَيْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلَائِكَتِكَ، وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'amsaytu 'ush-hiduka wa 'ush-hidu hamalata 'arshika, wa malaa'ikatika wajamee'a khalqika, 'annaka 'AntAllahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, wa 'anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa Rasooluka.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, verily I have reached evening and call on You, the bearers of Your throne, Your angels, and all of Your creation to witness that You are Allah, none has the right to be worshipped except You, alone, without any partner and that Muhammad is Your Servant and Messenger.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Allah will spare whoever says this four times in the morning or evening from the Hell-fire.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ مَا أَمْسَى بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma maa 'amsaa bee min ni'matin 'aw bi'ahadin min khalqika faminka wahdaka laa shareeka laka, falakal-hamdu wa lakash-shukru.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, what blessing I have received in this evening or any of Your creation, is from You alone, without any partner, so for You is all praise and unto You all thanks.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Whoever recites this in the morning, has completed his obligation to thank Allah for that day; and whoever says it in the evening, has completed his obligation for that night.

sub_title.duay: Say 100 times a day -
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Astaghfirullaaha wa 'atoobu 'ilayhi.
sub_title.translation: I seek Allah's forgiveness and I turn to Him in repentance.

sub_title.duay: 10 times salutation upon Prophet (ﷺ) -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّھُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَی مُحَمَّدٍ وَّعَلَی آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ کَمَا صَلَّیْتَ عَلَی اِبْرَاھِیْمَ وَعَلَی آلِ اِبْرَاھِیْمَ اِنَّكَ حَمِیْدٌ مَّجِیْدٌ، اَللَّھُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَی مُحَمَّدٍ وَّعَلَی آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ کَمَا بَارَکْتَ عَلَی اِبْرَاھِیْمَ وَعَلَی آلِ اِبْرَاھِیْمَ اِنَّكَ حَمِیْدٌ مَّجِیْدٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa sallayta 'alaa 'Ibraaheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed. Allaahumma baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'Ibraaheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad (ﷺ) and on the family of Muhammad (ﷺ) as You have bestowed Your favor on Ibrahim (A) and on the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious. O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You have blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet saw said: 'Who recites blessings upon me 10 times in the morning and 10 times in the evening will obtain my intercession on the Day of Resurrection

sub_title.duay: Say three times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِيْ لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Bismillaahil-lathee laa yadhurru ma'as-mihi shay'un fil-'ardhi wa laa fis-samaa'i wa Huwas-Samee 'ul- 'Aleem.
sub_title.translation: In the name of Allah with whose name nothing is harmed on earth nor in the heavens and He is The All-Seeing, The All-Knowing.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Uthman (RA) say: I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: If anyone says three times: In the name of Allah, when Whose name is mentioned nothing on Earth or in Heaven can cause harm, and He is the Hearer, the Knower he will not suffer sudden affliction till the morning, and if anyone says this in the morning, he will not suffer sudden affliction till the evening.

sub_title.duay: Say seven times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَاّ هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيْمِ
sub_title.transliteration: HasbiyAllahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa Huwa Rabbul-'Arshil-'Adheem.
sub_title.translation: Allah is Sufficient for me, none has the right to be worshipped except Him, upon Him I rely and He is Lord of the exalted throne.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abu al-Darda’ (RA) said: if anyone says these dua seven times morning and evening, Allah will be sufficient for him against anything which grieves him, whether he is true or false in (repeating) them.
sub_title.reference: Sahih Maquf (Shu'aib and Arnaut). Abu Daud: 5081

sub_title.duay: Dua in the morning & evening: Say once
sub_title.duay_arbi: يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّوْمُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أَسْتَغِيْثُ أَصْلِحْ لِي شَأْنِيْ كُلَّهُ وَلَا تَكِلْنِيْ إِلَى نَفْسِيْ طَرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ
sub_title.transliteration: Yaa Hayyu yaa Qayyoomu birahmatika 'astagheethu 'aslih lee sha'nee kullahu wa laa takilnee 'ilaa nafsee tarfata 'aynin
sub_title.translation: O Ever Living, O Self-Subsisting and Supporter of all, by Your mercy I seek assistance, rectify for me all of my affairs and do not leave me to myself, even for the blink of an eye.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Anas (RA) said, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) told Fatima (RA) that, I advice you that, you should supplicate this in the morning and evening

sub_title.duay: Say three times -
sub_title.duay_arbi: رَضِيْتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبًّا وَبِالْإِسْلَامِ دِيْنًا وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ نَبِيًّا
sub_title.transliteration: Radheetu billaahi Rabban, wa bil-'Islaami deenan, wa bi-Muhammadin Nabiyyan
sub_title.translation: I am pleased with Allah as a Lord, and Islaam as a religion and Muhammad (ﷺ) as a Prophet.
sub_title.reference: Sahih li ghairihi (Shu’aib al-Arnaut). Takhrijul Musnad: 23112

sub_title.duay: Say one time in the morning -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي قَدْ تَصَدَّقْتُ بِعِرْضِي عَلَى عِبَادِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innii qad tasaddaqtu bi-’irdi ‘ala ‘ibaadik
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I gave my honour As Charity/Sadaka to thy servants.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Tabi’ee ‘Abdur Ra’hman ibn Ajlaan or Sa’habi Anas (RA) Said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said that, Can't you be like Abu Damdam? Sa’habas are asked that who is Abu Damdam? he replied, is a person who lived before you. he said this sentence in every morning. In another narration in, He said, I honour him who rebuke me.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to save from the evil of the waning moon
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَعُوْذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنْ شَرِّ هٰذَا الغَاسِقِ
sub_title.transliteration: A‛oodhu Billahi Min Sharri Haazal Gasiq
sub_title.translation: I seek refuge in Allah from the misfortune of this disappearing moon.

sub_title.duay: After Fajr and Asr prayer, Subhanallah 100 times, Alhamdulillah 100 times, Allahu Akbar 100 times, La Ilaha Illallah hoo laa sharikalahu, lahul m ulku walahul ‘hamdu wa huwa ‘ala kulli shaiyin qaadir Hundred times ( for La Ilaha Illallah 100 times)
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Sub’hanallah
sub_title.translation: How perfect Allah is

sub_title.duay_title: Sayyidul Istighfar (Best way to ask forgiveness)
sub_title.duay: Sayyidul Istighfar (One time)-
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ وَأَبُوءُ (لَكَ) بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Anta Rabbee laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, khalaqtanee wa 'anaa 'abduka, wa 'anaa 'alaa 'ahdika wa wa'dika mas-tata'tu, 'A'oodhu bika min sharri maa sana'tu, 'aboo'u laka bini'matika 'alayya, wa 'aboo'u (laka) bithanbee faghfir lee fa'innahu laa yaghfiruth-thunooba 'illaa 'Anta.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, You are my Lord, none has the right to be worshipped except You, You created me and I am Your servant and I abide to Your covenant and promise as best I can, I take refuge in You from the evil of which I have committed. I acknowledge Your favour upon me and I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me, for verily none can forgive sin except You.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated Shaddad bin Aus, The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The most superior way of asking for forgiveness from Allah is (The dua is mentioned above). The Prophet (ﷺ) added. If somebody recites it during the day with firm faith in it, and dies on the same day before the evening, he will be from the people of Paradise; and if somebody recites it at night with firm faith in it, and dies before the morning, he will be from the people of Paradise.

sub_title.duay: Ayatul Kursi (One time)-
sub_title.duay_arbi: اللَّـهُ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلَّا بِمَا شَاءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَئُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ ﴿٢٥٥﴾
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwal-Haiyul-Qayyoom, laa ta'khuthuhu sinatun walaa nawm, lahu maa fis-samaawaati wamaa fil-'ardhi, man thal-lathee yashfa'u 'indahu 'illaa bi'ithnihi, ya'lamu maa bayna 'aydeehim wa maa khalfahum, wa laa yuheetoona bishay'im-min 'ilmihi 'illaa bimaa shaa'a, wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samaawaati wal'ardh, wa laa ya'ooduhu hifdhuhumaa, wa Huwal-'Aliyyul- 'Adheem.
sub_title.translation: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ubay bin Ka’ab (RA) reported that, anyone recite ayatul kursi in the morning he will be protected from Jinn till the evening and if he recite in the evening he will be protected from Jinn till the morning. Note: If anyone recite it after Fajr prayer one time then he will get both the benefits of reciting it in the morning and benefits of reciting it after Fajr prayer.

sub_title.duay: Sura Nas three times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّـهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوْذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾
sub_title.translation: (1) Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, (2) The Sovereign of mankind. (3) The ilah of mankind, (4) From the evil of the retreating whisperer - (5) Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - (6) From among the jinn and mankind. (Sura Nas: 1-6)

sub_title.duay_title: One Hundred times Subhanallahi wa Bihamdihi
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Sub’hanallahil ‘adhim wa bi’hamdihi
sub_title.translation: Glory be to Allah and all praise is due to him, glory be to Allah the great.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abu Hurairah (RA) said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said that, if anyone recite “Sub’hanallahi wa bi’hamdihi” hundred times in the morning and in the evening, then you will bring largest rewards then anyone in the day of resurrection, except who recite it more than him. In the other narration, he will be forgiven even if his sins are greater than the foams of the sea. Another narration, the dhikr was mentioned as “Sub’hanallahil ‘adhim wa bi’hamdihi

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to stay free from hatred and animosity
sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَانِنَا الَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِالْإِيمَانِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِي قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ ﴿١٠﴾
sub_title.transliteration: Rabbanaghfir lana wali ikhwanina alladheena sabaqoona bileemani wala taj'aal fee quloobina ghillan lilladheena amanoo rabbana innaka raoofur raheem
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful.

sub_title.duay: Say three times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَدَنِي اَللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِي سَمْعِي اَللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِيْ فِي بَصَرِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ وَالْفَقْرِ اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'aafinee fee badanee, Allaahumma 'aafinee fee sam'ee, Allaahumma 'aafinee fee basaree, laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta. Allaahumma 'innee 'A'oodhu bika minal-kufri, wal-faqri, wa 'A'oodhu bika min 'athaabil-qabri, laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, grant my body health, O Allah, grant my hearing health, O Allah, grant my sight health. None has the right to be worshipped except You. O Allah, I take refuge with You from disbelief and poverty, and I take refuge with You from the punishment of the grave. None has the right to be worshipped except You.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdur Rahman ibn Abu Bakr (RA) said that he told his father: O my father! I hear you supplicating every morning. You repeat them three times in the morning and three times in the evening. Then Abu Bakrah said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) using these words as a supplication and I like to follow his practice.

sub_title.duay_title: Ask Pardon from the evil of oneself and shaitan
sub_title.duay: In the morning or evening, say -
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ عَالِمَ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَاطِرَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ، رَبَّ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَمَلِيكَهُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِي، وَمِنْ شَرِّ الشَّيْطَانِ وَشِرْكِهِ ، وَأَنْ أَقْتَرِفَ عَلَى نَفْسِي سُوْءًا، أَوْ أَجُرَّهُ إِلَى مُسْلِمٍ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Aalimal-ghaybi wash-shahaadati faatiras-samaawaati wal'ardhi, Rabba kulli shay'in wa maleekahu, 'ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta, 'A'oodhu bika min sharri nafsee, wa min sharrish-shaytaani wa shirkihi, wa 'an 'aqtarifa 'alaa nafsee soo'an, 'aw 'ajurrahu 'ilaa Muslim.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Creator of the heavens and the Earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things, I bear witness that none has the right to be worshipped except You. I take refuge in You from the evil of my soul and from the evil and shirk of the devil, and from committing wrong against my soul or bringing such upon another Muslim.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abu Bakr As-Siddiq (RA) said: “O Messenger of Allah, teach me what to say at morning and afternoon.” He said: “O Abu Bakr, say (above dua)

sub_title.duay_title: Asking for pardon, wellbeing and refuge from all sides
sub_title.duay: In the morning (evening) say,
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي دِينِيْ وَدُنْيَايَ وَأَهْلِيْ، وَمَالِيْ، اَللَّهُمَّ اسْتُرْ عَوْرَاتِيْ، وَآمِنْ رَوْعَاتِيْ، اَللَّهُمَّ احْفَظْنِي مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيَّ وَمِنْ خَلْفِي وَعَنْ يَمِيْنِيْ وَعَنْ شِمَالِي وَمِنْ فَوْقِيْ وَأَعُوْذُ بِعَظَمَتِكَ أَنْ أُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِيْ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'afwa wal'aafiyata fid-dunyaa wal'aakhirah, Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-'afwa wal'aafiyata fee deenee wa dunyaaya wa 'ahlee, wa maalee, Allahum-mastur 'awraatee, wa 'aamin raw'aatee, Allahum-mahfadhnee mim bayni yadayya, wa min khalfee, wa 'an yameenee, wa 'an shimaalee, wa min fawqee, wa 'A'oodhu bi'adhamatika 'an 'ughtaala min tahtee.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in this life and the next. O Allah, I ask You for pardon and well-being in my religious and worldly affairs, and my family and my wealth. O Allah, veil my weaknesses and set at ease my dismay. O Allah, preserve me from the front and from behind and on my right and on my left and from above, and I take refuge with You lest I be swallowed up by the earth.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdullah ibn Umar (RA) Said that, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) never forget to utter these supplications in the evening and in the morning.

sub_title.duay: This Dua is regarded as a special dhikr of masnun dhikr-
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wa'hdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer.
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, He is alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Many hadiths are narrated about benefit of this dhikr. Many authentic reports commanded us to to recite this dua in every morning and evening 1 or 10 or 100 or 200 times, After every obligatory prayer, and generally without any time restriction.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَعُوْذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
sub_title.transliteration: A'oodhu bikalimaatil-laahit-taammaati min sharri maa khalaq
sub_title.translation: I take refuge in Allah's perfect words from the evil He has created.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abu Huraira (RA) reported that a person came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), I was stung by a scorpion during the night. Thereupon he said: Had you recited these words in the evening. (The dua is mentioned above) that would not harm you

sub_title.duay_title: What to do in the beginning of the evening
sub_title.duay: When night falls [i.e., at al-Maghrib], restrain your children [from going out] because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention Allah's name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your water-skins and mention Allah's name, cover your vessels with anything and mention Allah's name and put out your lamps.

sub_title.duay_title: Asking for Beneficial Knowledge, Pure Rizq & Accepted Deeds
sub_title.duay: Say 3 times in the morning:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا، وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا، وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka 'ilman naafi'an, wa rizqan tayyiban, wa 'amalan mutaqabbalan.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge which is beneficial and sustenance which is good, and deeds which are acceptable.

sub_title.duay_title: Seeking security in this world and in the Hereafter
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ الْعَافِيَةَ فِيْ الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ
sub_title.transliteration: As’alullaahal ‘aafiyata feed dunyaa wal akhirah.
sub_title.translation: I seek security from Allah in this World and Hereafter.

sub_title.duay_title: Two most favourite words to the Most Merciful
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيْمِ
sub_title.transliteration: Subhanallahi wa bi'hamdihi wa sub'hanallahil 'adhim
sub_title.translation: Glory be to Allah and His is the praise, (and) Allah, the Greatest is free from imperfection
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, (There are) two words which are dear to the Beneficent (Allah) and very light (easy) for the tongue (to say), but very heavy in weight in the balance. They are: ''Subhan Allah wa-bi hamdihi'' and ''Subhan Allah Al-`Azim

sub_title.duay_title: Dua for getting the right guidance
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْتَهْدِيكَ لِأَرْشَدِ أَمْرِي، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ نَفْسِيْ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahumma inni astahdika li-arshadi amri, wa ‘auzubika min sharri nafsi
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek guidance from You in all matters, and I seek refuge in You from my own evil.

sub_title.duay_title: A dua which can be recited all the time
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَارْحَمْنِيْ وَاهْدِنِيْ وَعَافِنِيْ وَارْزُقْنِيْ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahummaghfir lee, war'hamnee, wa'hdinee, wa 'aafinee warzuqnee
sub_title.translation: O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me and give me good health and provide rizq for me.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abu Malik reported on the authority of his father that when a person embraced Islam, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to teach him how to observe prayer and then commanded him to supplicate in these words.

sub_title.duay_title: When entering the market, city or workplace
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ، وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لَا يَمُوتُ، بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha illallahu wa'hdahu laa sharika lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-'hamdu, yu'hyi wa yumitu, wa Huwa 'hayyun laa yamutu, bi yadihil-khairu, wa Huwa 'ala kulli shay’in Qadir.
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshiped but Allah alone, with no partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and to Him is the praise, He gives life and gives death, and He is Ever-Living and does not die; in His Hand is all goodness and He is Able to do all things.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Umar ibn al-Khattab (RA) said that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: “Whoever enters the marketplace and says these words, Allah shall record a million good deeds for him, wipe a million evil deeds away from him, raise a million ranks for him and build a palace in Jannah for him

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to stay safe from the evil of the nafs
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ قِنِيْ شَرَّ نَفْسِيْ، وَاعْزِمْ لِيْ عَلٰى أَرْشَدِ أَمْرِيْ اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِيْ مَا أَسْرَرْتُ وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُ، وَمَا أَخْطَأْتُ وَمَا عَمَدْتُّ، وَمَا جَهِلْتُ.
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma qini sharra nafsi, wa’jim lee alaa arshadi amri, Allaahummaghfir lee maa as’rartu wa maa a’lantu wa maa akhta’tu wa maa amadtu wa maa jahiltu.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, keep me safe from the evil of my soul. Give me a strong will to do good in all things. O Allah, forgive me all that I have done openly and secretly, that which I have done willingly and unwillingly, and that which I have done in ignorance.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to seek refuge from fitna
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اِنَّا نَعُوْذُ بِكَ اَنْ نَرْجِعَ عَلٰى أَعْقَابِنَا أَوْ نُفْتَنَ عَنْ دِيْنِنَا.
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inna nau’dhu bika an narji’ya ‘alaa a’qaabinaa aw nuftana an dininaa.
sub_title.translation: O Allah, we seek refuge with You from turning on our heels, or being put to trial in our religion.

sub_title.duay: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّـهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّـهِ الَّذِي أَنزَلَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ الْكِتَابَ وَلَمْ يَجْعَل لَّهُ عِوَجًا ۜ ﴿١﴾ قَيِّمًا لِّيُنذِرَ بَأْسًا شَدِيدًا مِّن لَّدُنْهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ الَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ الصَّالِحَاتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا ﴿٢﴾ مَّاكِثِينَ فِيهِ أَبَدًا ﴿٣﴾ وَيُنذِرَ الَّذِينَ قَالُوا اتَّخَذَ اللَّـهُ وَلَدًا ﴿٤﴾ مَّا لَهُم بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ وَلَا لِآبَائِهِمْ ۚ كَبُرَتْ كَلِمَةً تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ ۚ إِن يَقُولُونَ إِلَّا كَذِبًا ﴿٥﴾ فَلَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ عَلَىٰ آثَارِهِمْ إِن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِهَـٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ أَسَفًا ﴿٦﴾ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا مَا عَلَى الْأَرْضِ زِينَةً لَّهَا لِنَبْلُوَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ﴿٧﴾ وَإِنَّا لَجَاعِلُونَ مَا عَلَيْهَا صَعِيدًا جُرُزًا ﴿٨﴾ أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَابَ الْكَهْفِ وَالرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا مِنْ آيَاتِنَا عَجَبًا ﴿٩﴾ إِذْ أَوَى الْفِتْيَةُ إِلَى الْكَهْفِ فَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا آتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا ﴿١٠﴾
sub_title.translation: (1) [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance. (2) [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward (3) In which they will remain forever (4) And to warn those who say,  Allah has taken a son. (5) They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie. (6) Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow. (7) Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed. (8) And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground. (9) Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder? (10) [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance. (Sura Kahf: 1-10)
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, If anyone learns by heart the first ten verses of the Surah al-Kahf, he will be protected from the Dajjal.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua of custody from evil eye and disease
sub_title.duay_arbi: أُعِيذُكُمَا [أَعُوْذُ] بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّةِ مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ وَهَامَّةٍ وَمِنْ كُلِّ عَيْنٍ لَامَّةٍ
sub_title.transliteration: Oo-'idhukumaa (For self: A'ooudhu) bi kalimaat-illaahit-taammati min kulli shaytaanin wa haammah, wa min kulli ‛aynin laammah
sub_title.translation: I commend you to the protection of Allah’s perfect words from every devil, vermin, and every evil eye.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to seek Refuge with Allah for Al-Hasan and Al-Husain and say: Your forefather (i.e. Abraham) used to seek Refuge with Allah for Ishmael and Isaac by reciting.

section.section_title: Some duas mentioned in the hadith

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ جَهْدِ الْبَلَاءِ وَدَرَكِ الشَّقَاءِ وَسُوْءِ الْقَضَاءِ وَشَمَاتَةِ الْأَعْدَاءِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee ‘a’oodhu bika min jahdil-balaa’i, wa darakish-shaqaa’i, wa soo’il qadhaa’i, wa shamaatatil-‘a’adaa
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with Allah from the difficult moment of a calamity and from being overtaken by destruction and from being destined to an evil end, and from the malicious joy of enemies.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْهَرَمِ وَعَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، اَللَّهُمَّ آتِ نَفْسِيْ تَقْوَاهَا وَزَكِّهَا أَنْتَ خَيْرُ مَنْ زَكَّاهَا أَنْتَ وَلِيُّهَا وَمَوْلَاهَا، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ لَا يَنْفَعُ وَمِنْ قَلْبٍ لَا يَخْشَعُ وَمِنْ نَفْسٍ لَا تَشْبَعُ وَمِنْ دَعْوَةٍ لَا يُسْتَجَابُ لَهَا.
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee a‛oodhu bika minal ‛ajzi wal-kasali, wal-jubni wal-bukhli, wal harami wa ‛adhaabil-qabr, Allaahumma aati nafsee taq-waahaa wa zakkihaa anta khairu man zakkaahaa anta wali-yuhaa wa mawlaahaa, Allaahumma inni a‛oodhu bika min ‛ilmin laa yanfa‛u, wa min qalbin laa yakh-sha‛u, wa min nafsin laa tashba‛u, wa min da‛wat-in laa yustajaabu lahaa
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You from weakness, and laziness, cowardice and miserliness, old and infirm age, and the torment of the grave. O Allah, give my soul piety and purify it, for indeed You are the best of those who can purify it, You are it's Guardian and Master. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from knowledge that does not benefit, from a heart that does not get humbled [to Allah], from a soul which is never satisfied and from a supplication which does not get answered.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ زَوَالِ نِعْمَتِكَ، وَتَحَوُّلِ عَافِيَتِكَ، وَفُجَاءَةِ نِقْمَتِكَ وَجَمِيْعِ سَخَطِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni A‛oodhu bika min zawaali ni'matika, wa tahawwuli 'afiyatika, wa fujaa-ati niqmatika, wa jami'i sakhatik
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee from the withdrawal of your blessing and the change of your protection (from me) and from the sudden your wrath, and from your every displeasure.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ ارْزُقْنِي حُبَّكَ وَحُبَّ مَنْ يَنْفَعُنِي حُبُّهُ عِنْدَكَ اَللَّهُمَّ مَا رَزَقْتَنِي مِمَّا أُحِبُّ فَاجْعَلْهُ قُوَّةً لِي فِيمَا تُّحِبُّ، اَللَّهُمَّ وَمَا زَوَيْتَ عَنِّي مِمَّا أُحِبُّ فَاجْعَلْهُ لِي فَرَاغًا فِيمَا تُحِبُّ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahummar zuqni 'hubbaka, wa 'hubba man yanfa’uni 'hubbuhu ‘indaka. Allaahumma maa razaqtani mimma u'hibbu faaj’alhu quwwatan lee fimaa tu'hibbu. Allaahumma wa maa zawaita ‘anni mimma u'hibbu faaj’alhu lee faraaghan fimaa tu'hibbu
sub_title.translation: O Allah grant me Your love and the love of those whose love will benefit me. O Allah, whatever you have provided me of that which I love, make it strength for me for achieving that which You love. O Allah, and what you have kept from me of that which I love, then make it for me a period of rest for achieving that which You love.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ زِدْنَا وَلَا تَنْقُصْنَا وَأَكْرِمْنَا وَلَا تُهِنَّا وَأَعْطِنَا وَلَا تَحْرِمْنَا وَآثِرْنَا وَلَا تُؤْثِرْ عَلَيْنَا وَأَرْضِنَا وَارْضَ عَنَّا
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma zidnaa wa laa tanqusnaa, wa akrimnaa wa laa tuhinnaa, wa aa-tinaa wa laa tahrimnaa, wa athir-naa wa laa tu-'thir ‘alaynaa, wa ardinaa warda ‘annaa
sub_title.translation: O Allah! Increase us [in Your Blessings] and do not decrease us, honor us and do not humiliate us, give us [from Your Gifts] and do not deprive us, be in favor of us and not against us, and make us satisfied and be satisfied with us.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْهُدَى وَالتُّقَى وَالْعَفَافَ وَالْغِنَى
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as-alukal hudaa wattuqa, wal 'afaafa wal ghinaa
sub_title.translation: O Allah, indeed, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and sufficiency.

sub_title.duay_arbi: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوْبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِيْ عَلَى دِيْنِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Ya Muqallibal-qulubi, thabbit qalbi `alaa dinik
sub_title.translation: O Changer of the hearts, make my heart firm upon Your religion.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَحْسِنْ عَاقِبَتَنَا فِي الْأُمُوْرِ كُلِّهَا، وَأَجِرْنَا مِنْ خِزْيِ الدُّنْيَا وَعَذَابِ الْآخِرَةِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma a’hsin ‘aaqibatanaa fil-umuri kullihaa, wa ajirnaa min khizy-id dunyaa wa adhaabil akhirah
sub_title.translation: O Allah! grant us a good outcome on all of our affairs and save us from the disgrace of this world and the punishment of the Hereafter.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبَرَصِ وَالْجُنُوْنِ وَالْجُذَامِ وَمِنْ سَيِّئِ الْأَسْقَامِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni a‛oodhu bika minal-barasi, wal-jununi, wal-judhami, wa min sayyi'il-asqam
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee from leprosy, madness, elephantiasis, and evil diseases.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ حْفَظْنِي بِالْإِسْلَامِ قَائِمًا وَاحْفَظْنِي بِالْإِسْلَامِ قَاعِدًا وَحْفَظْنِي بِالْإِسْلَامِ رَاقِدًا وَلَا تُشْمِتْ بِي عَدُوًّا وَلَا حَسِدًا، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ كُلِّ خَيْرٍ خَزَائِنُهُ بِيَدِكَ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ كُلِّ شَرٍّ خَزَائِنُهُ بِيَدِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma’h fazni bil-islaami qaa'iman wa’h faazni bil-islaami qaa'idan wa’h fazni bil-islaami raaqidan walaa tushmit bi ‘aduwan walaa ‘hasidan. Allaahumma inni as-aluka min kulli khayrin khazaa-inuhu bi yadik, wa A‛oodhu bika min kulli sharrin khazaa-inuhu bi yadik
sub_title.translation: O Allah! Protect me with Islam when standing, and protect me with Islam when sitting down, and protect me with Islam when reclining, and do not make an enemy or envier rejoice at me. O Allah! I ask you for every good whose stores are in Your Hand, and I seek refuge with you from every evil whose stores are in Your Hand.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ أَوْسَعَ رِزْقِكَ عَلَىَّ عِنْدَ كِبَرِ سِنِّي وَانْقِطَاعِ عُمُرِي
sub_title.transliteration: Allahumm-aj'al Awsa'a Rizqika Alayya inda kibari sinni wan qita-i umuri
sub_title.translation: O Allah! Expand for me Your provision till my old age and till the end of my life.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْعَجْزِ وَالْكَسَلِ وَالْجُبْنِ وَالْبُخْلِ وَالْهَرَمِ وَالْقَسْوَةِ وَالْغَفْلَةِ وَالْعَيْلَةِ وَالذِّلَّةِ وَالْمَسْكَنَةِ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْفَقْرِ وَالْكُفْرِ وَالْفُسُوْقِ وَالشِّقَّاقِ وَالنِّفَقِ وَالسُّمْعَةِ والرِّيَاءِ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الصَّمَمِ وَالْبَكَمِ وَالْجُنُوْنِ وَالْجُذَامِ وَالْبَرَصِ وَسَيِّءِ الْأَسْقَامِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni A‛oodhu bika minal-'ajzi, wal-kasali, wal-jubni, wal-bukhli, wal-harami, wal qaswati wal ghaflati wal’aylati wadh-dhillati wal maskanati wa a’uudhu bika minal faqri wal kufri wal fusuuqi wash-shiqaaqi wan nifaaqi was-sum’ati war-riyaai wa A‛oodhu bika minas-samami wal bakami wal junuuni wal judhaami wal barasi wasayyi-il-asqaam
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from Inability; lethargy; Cowardice, Miserliness, Senility, Hard heartedness, Heedlessness, Deprivation; Humiliation, misery; And I seek refuge in You from absolute poverty, Disbelief, Rebellion; Dissension, Hypocrisy, Seeking fame, And showing off, And I seek refuge in You from deafness, Being mute, Insanity; Leprosy, Leukederma, And from any worst kind of illness.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ يَوْمِ السُّوءِ وَمِنْ لَيْلَةِ السُّوءِ وَمِنْ سَاعَةِ السُّوءِ وَمِنْ صَاحِبِ السُّوءِ وَمِنْ جَارِ السُّوءِ فِي دَارِ الْمُقَامَةِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee A‛oodhu bika min yawmis-suu’i, wa min laylatis-suu’i, wa min saa‛atis-suu’i, wa min saa’hibis-suu’i, wa min jaaris-suu’i fee daaril-muqaamah
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from bad days, bad nights, bad hours, bad companions, and bad neighbours in my place of residence.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ انْفَعْنِي بِمَا عَلَّمْتَنِي وَعَلِّمْنِي مَا يَنْفَعُنِي وَزِدْنِي عِلْمًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-manfa'ni bima 'al-lamtani, wa 'al-limni maa yanfa'uni, wa zidni 'ilma
sub_title.translation: Oh Allah, benefit me with what You have taught me and teach me what benefits me, and increase me in knowledge.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ مَتِّعْنِي بِسَمْعِي وَبَصَرِي وَاجْعَلْهُمَا الْوَارِثَ مِنِّي، وَانْصُرْنِي عَلَى مَنْ ظَلَمَنِي وَخُذْ مِنْهُ بِثَأْرِي
sub_title.transliteration: Allahumm-a matti‛ni bi sam‛i wa basari waj-‛alhumal-waaritha minni, wan-surni ‛alaa man zalamani, wa khudh minhu bi tha’ri
sub_title.translation: O Allah, grant me enjoyment of my hearing and sight, and keep them healthy and sound until the day I die, and aid me against those who oppress me, and avenge me from them.

sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: bismillaahi, tawakkaltu 'alal-laahi, laa hawla wa laa quwwata illaa billaah
sub_title.translation: In the name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah and there is no might nor power except with Allah.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated Anas ibn Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: When a man goes out of his house and say these words, the following will be said to him at that time: You are guided, defended and protected The devils will go far from him and another devil will say: How can you deal with a man who has been guided, defended and protected?

sub_title.duay: Umm Salamah (RA) narrated that: When the Prophet (ﷺ) would leave his house, he would say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ اَللَّـهُمَّ إِنَّا نَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ أَنْ نَزِلَّ أَوْ نَضِلَّ أَوْ نَظْلِمَ أَوْ نُظْلَمَ أَوْ نَجْهَلَ أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيْنَا
sub_title.transliteration: Bismillaahi, tawakkaltu 'alal-laahi. Allaahumma, inna na`udhu bika min an nazilla aw nadilla, aw nazlima aw nuzlama, aw najhala aw yujhala 'alaina
sub_title.translation: In the Name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah. O Allah! We seek refuge in You from slipping unintentionally or becoming misguided, or committing oppression or being oppressed, or acting ignorantly or being treated ignorantly.
sub_title.duay_hadis: A mu'min should recite these adhkar by his/her heart whenever (Day/Night) he/she goes outside.

sub_title.duay: Umm Salamah (RA) said, whenever Rasul (ﷺ) went outside my home he recite these words looking at the sky-
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّـهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَضِلَّ، أَوْ أُضَلَّ، أَوْ أَزِلَّ، أَوْ أُزَلَّ، أَوْ أَظْلِمَ، أَوْ أُظْلَمَ، أَوْ أَجْهَلَ، أَوْ يُجْهَلَ عَلَيَّ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee a‛oodhu bika an adilla aw udalla, aw azilla aw uzalla, aw azlima aw uzlama, aw adhala aw yudhala ‛alayya
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with You lest I should stray or be led astray, or slip (i.e. to commit a sin unintentionally) or be tripped, or oppress or be oppressed, or behave foolishly or be treated foolishly.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ الْمَوْلِجِ وَخَيْرَ الْمَخْرَجِ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَلَجْنَا وَبِسْمِ اللَّهِ خَرَجْنَا وَعَلَى اللَّهِ رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّلْنَا
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as'aluka khairal-mawliji wa khairal-makhraji. Bismillahi wa lajna, wa bismillahi kharajna, wa 'al-Allahi rabbina tawakkalna
