sub_title.translation: Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ayesha (RA) said that Rasulullah (ﷺ) used to recite it in rukoo and sujood.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ لَكَ رَكَعْتُ وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ خَشَعَ لَكَ سَمْعِيْ وَبَصَرِيْ وَمُخِّيْ وَعِظَامِيْ وَعَصَبِيْ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma laka raka'tu, wa bika 'aamantu, wa laka 'aslamtu khasha'a laka sam'ee, wa basaree, wa mukhkhee, wa 'idhaamee, wa 'asabee
sub_title.translation: O Allah, to You I bow (in prayer) and in You I believe and to You I have submitted. Before You my hearing is humbled, as is my sight, my mind, my bones, my nerves.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ali (RA) said, Rasulullah (ﷺ) used to say these words in rukoo.

sub_title.duay: It is narrated on the authority of Auf Ibn Malik Ashja'i (RA) that the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say in ruku:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ ذِي الْجَبَرُوْتِ وَالْمَلَكُوْتِ وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ وَالْعَظَمَةِ
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaana dhil-jabarooti, wal-malakooti, wal-kibriyaa'i, wal-'adhamah
sub_title.translation: Glory is to You, Master of power, of dominion, of majesty and greatness.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Then he prostrated and paused as long as he stood and recited Surat Aal Imran and then recited other surahs one after another.

sub_title.duay: ‘Abdullah ibn Mas’ud (RA) said that the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say in bowing and prostration:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَكَ وَبِحَمْدِكَ أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوْبُ اِلَيْكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaanaka wa bihamdika, 'astaghfiruka wa 'atoobu 'ilayk
sub_title.translation: Glory is to You O Allah, and praise. I ask you for forgiveness and I turn to you (from sinning).

sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَكَ اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma Rabbanaa wa bihamdika Allahum-maghfir lee
sub_title.translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me. [1]
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated from Aisha (RA), she said that according to the instructions of the Qur'an, [2] the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say this dua more and more in bowing down and prostration - (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ لَكَ رَكَعْتُ، وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ، وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ، أَنْتَ رَبِّي، خَشَعَ لَكَ سَمْعِي وَبَصَرِي وَمُخِّي وَعَظْمِي وَعَصَبِي وَمَا اِسْتَقَلَّتْ بِهِ قَدَمِي لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahumma laka raka’tu wa bika amantu wa laka aslamtu, anta rabbi khasha’a laka sam’i wa basari wa mukh-khi wa ‘azmi wa ‘asabi wa ma istaqallat bihi qadami lillahi rabbil ‘alamin
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I have bowed down to You, I have believed, I have surrendered. You are my Rabb, my ear-eye, my brain, my bones, my spine and my legs, all that you are carrying (i.e. my existence) have been humbled before Allah Almighty.

sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَكَ اَللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaanaka allahumma wa bihamdika, laa ilaaha illaa anta.
sub_title.translation: O Allah glory is to You; there is no worthy of worship except You.

sub_title.duay: Dua for rising from rukoo:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سَمِعَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ حَمِدَهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Sami'Allahu liman hamidah
sub_title.translation: Allah hears whoever praises Him.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا لَكَ الْحَمْدُ، مِلْءَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَمِلْءَ الْأَرْضِ، وَمِلْءَ مَا شِئْتَ مِنْ شَيْءٍ بَعْدُ، أَهْلَ الثَّنَاءِ وَالْمَجْدِ، أَحَقُّ مَا قَالَ الْعَبْدُ، وَكُلُّنَا لَكَ عَبْدٌ، اَللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma Rabbanaa lakal-hamdu mil'as-samawaati wa mil’al-ardi, wa mil'a maa shi'ta min shay'in ba'du, ahlath-thanaa'i wal-majdi, ahaqqu maa qaalal 'abdu, wa kullunaa laka 'abdun. Allaahumma laa maani'a limaa a'taita, wa laa mu'tiya limaa mana'ta, wa laa yanfa'u dhal-jaddi minkal-jaddu
sub_title.translation: O Allah, our Rabb (Lord), to You is praise in all the heavens and all the earth, and all that You Will (to create) afterwards, O You, Who are worthy of praise and glory, the most worthy of what a slave says - and we are all Your slaves: no one can withhold what You give, or give what You withhold, and riches cannot avail a wealthy person against You.

section.section_title: Duas while in a state of rukoo

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #1
sub_title.duay: The duas of rukoo' are narrated in different sahih hadiths in four ways:
sub_title.duay_arbi: (اَللَّهُمَّ) رَبَّنَا لَكَ الْحَمْدُ
sub_title.transliteration: (1) Rabbanaa lakal-hamd (2) Allaahumma Rabbanaa lakal-hamd
sub_title.translation: [1] Our Lord, to You be the praise. [2] O Allah, our Lord, to You be the praise.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #2
sub_title.duay_arbi: (اَللَّهُمَّ) رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ
sub_title.transliteration: (1) Rabbanaa wa lakal-hamd (2) Allaahumma Rabbanaa wa lakal-hamd
sub_title.translation: [1] Our Lord and to You be the praise. [2] O Allah, our Lord and to You be the praise.
sub_title.duay_hadis: After rukoo' one should stand straight for a while. It is obligatory upon all. If anyone goes to prostration before stand straight (for a while) then it will invalidate his salaah. In the state of rukoo' one should say one of these four duas. It is recommended to say these supplications alternatively.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #3
sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، حَمْدًا كَثِيرًا طَيِّبًا مُبَارَكًا فِيهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Rabbanaa wa lakal-hamd, hamdan katheeran tayyiban mubaarakan feeh
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, praise is Yours, abundant, holy and blessed praise.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #4
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا لَكَ الْحَمْدُ مِلْءَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَمِلْءَ الْأَرْضِ وَمِلْءَ مَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمِلْءَ مَا شِئْتَ مِنْ شَيْءٍ بَعْدُ
sub_title.transliteration: Alla-humma Rabbanaa lakal ‘hamdu mil-as samawaati wa mil-al ardi wa mil-aa maa baina humaa, wa mil-aa maa shi’ta min shayin ba’du
sub_title.translation: Praise be to You, O Allah, our Lord! Praise be to You, it fills the heavens, fills the earth, completes all that is in between them, and then it completes whatever You will.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ibn Abi Aufa (R), Ibn Abbas (RA), Ali (RA) and other Companions said that the Prophet (ﷺ) used to say these words when he stand up from rukoo'.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #5
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا لَكَ الْحَمْدُ مِلْءَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَمِلْءَ الْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَمِلْءَ مَا شِئْتَ مِنْ شَيءٍ بَعْدُ أَهْلَ الثَّنَاءِ وَالْمَجْدِ، لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma, rabbanaa lakal ‘hamdu, mil-as samawaati wa mil-al ardi wamaa bainahumaa, wa mil-aa maa shi’ta min shayin ba’du, ahlath thanaa’i wal majdi. Laa- maani'a limaa a'taita, walaa mut'ia limaa mana'ta, walaa yanfa'u dhal jaddi minkal jaddu
sub_title.translation: Allah! our Lord, to Thee be the praise that would fill the heavens and the earth and that which is between them, and that which will please Thee besides (them). Worthy art Thou of all praise and glory. No one can withhold what Thou givest, or give what Thou withholdest. And the greatness O! the great availeth not against Thee.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #6
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ حَمْدًا كَثِيرًا طَيِّبًا مُبَارَكًا فِيهِ مُبَارَكًا عَلَيْهِ كَمَا يُحِبُّ رَبُّنَا وَيَرْضَى
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdu lillahi hamdan kathiran tayyiban mubarakan fihi mubarakan ‘alaihi kamaa yuhibbu rabbunaa wa yardaa
sub_title.translation: Praise be to Allah, much good and blessed praise as our Lord loves and is pleased with
sub_title.duay_hadis: Rifa'ah bin Rafi' (RA) said that: I prayed behind the Prophet (ﷺ) and I sneezed and said: (the dua is mentioned above) When he finished praying, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Who is the one who spoke during the prayer?' But no one said anything. Then he said it a second time: 'Who is the one who spoke during the prayer?' So Rifa'ah bin Rafi bin Afrah (RA) said: 'It was me, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'I said: (the dua is mentioned above)' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'By the One in Whose hand is my soul, thirty-odd angels hastened to see which of them would take it up.'

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #7
sub_title.duay_arbi: لِرَبِّيَ الْحَمْدُ
sub_title.transliteration: li-rabbi-al hamd
sub_title.translation: To my Lord belongs all praise

sub_title.duay_title: Dua while in a state of rukoo #8
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا لَكَ الْحَمْدُ مِلْءَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَمِلْءَ الأَرْضِ وَمِلْءَ مَا شِئْتَ مِنْ شَىْءٍ بَعْدُ، اَللَّهُمَّ طَهِّرْنِي بِالثَّلْجِ وَالْبَرَدِ وَالْمَاءِ الْبَارِدِ اَللَّهُمَّ طَهِّرْنِي مِنَ الذُّنُوبِ وَالْخَطَايَا كَمَا يُنَقَّى الثَّوْبُ الأَبْيَضُ مِنَ الْوَسَخِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma, rabbanaa lakal ‘hamdu, mil-as samawaati wa mil-al ardi wa mil-aa maa shi’ta min shayin ba’du, Allaahumma tah-hirni bith-thalji wal baaradi wal ma-il baarad, Allaahumma tah-hirni minadh dhunubi wal khataaya kamaa yunakkath thawbul abyadu minal wasakh.
sub_title.translation: O Allah! our Lord, unto Thee be praise that would fill the heavens and the earth and fill that which will please Thee besides (them). O Allah! purify me with snow, (water of) hail and with cold water; O Allah. cleanse me from the sins and errors just as a white garment is cleansed from dirt.

sub_title.duay_title: To do Dua more and more in the state of sijdaah
sub_title.duay: Abu Hurairah (RA) said that the Prophet (ﷺ) said that man is most close to his Lord in prostration. Therefore, do dua more and more in sujood.

sub_title.duay_title: Forbidden to recite the Qur'an in the state of prostration
sub_title.duay: Ibn 'Abbas (RA) said, the Prophet (ﷺ) said, I am forbidden to read the Qur'an in bowing and prostration. But in ruku 'you describe the greatness of Allah. And do more and more Dua in sujood. Sujood is a suitable place for accepting your Dua. [1]
sub_title.duay_hadis: It is evident from the above-mentioned hadiths that, one should supplicate more and more in the state of prostration. And in this state, the dua is answered. So, one can supplicate any dua mentioned in authentic hadiths except quranic duas. Cause it is prohibited to supplicate by quranic dua in the state of bowing down and prostration.

sub_title.duay: Qatadah (RA) said, the Prophet (ﷺ) said, the worst thief is the one who steals the prayer. The Companions said, how do you steal the prayer? The Prophet (ﷺ) said: He who does not complete his bowing and prostration.
Say at least three times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الْأَعْلَى
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaana Rabbiyal-A'laa
sub_title.translation: Glory is to my Lord, the Most High.
sub_title.duay_hadis: This dua should be repeat again and again with the emotion of the mind. Reciting this tasbeeh at least three times is the conduct and instruction of Rasulullah (ﷺ). Most of the narrations mention `Subhaana Rabbiyal-A 'laa` and some of the hadiths describe `Subhana Rabbiyal-A 'laa wa bihamdihi`. After reciting every verse of mercy, he stopped and asked Allah for it, and after reciting every verse of punishment, he stopped and asked Allah for refuge from it.

sub_title.duay: Say at least three times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ رَبِّيَ الْأَعْلَى وَبِحَمْدِهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaana Rabbiyal-A'laa wa bihamdihi
sub_title.translation: Glory and praise be to my most high Lord.

sub_title.duay: Abu Hurairah (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say in prostration:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي ذَنْبِيْ كُلَّهُ دِقَّهُ وَجِلَّهُ، وَأَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ، وَعَلَانِيَّتَهُ وَسِرَّهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-maghfir lee dhanbee kullahu, diqqahu wa jillahu, wa 'awwalahu wa 'aakhirahu wa 'alaa-niyyatahu wa sirrahu
sub_title.translation: O Allah, forgive me all my sins, great and small, the first and the last, those that are apparent and those that are hidden.

sub_title.duay: Ayesha (RA) said, I did not find Rasulullah (ﷺ) in bed one night. (In the dark) I searched for him. Then my hand touched the sole of his foot. He was then in prostration and his legs were erect. He was saying:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِرِضَاكَ مِنْ سَخَطِكَ، وَبِمُعَافَاتِكَ مِنْ عُقُوبَتِكَ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْكَ، لَا أُحْصِيْ ثَنَاءً عَلَيْكَ، أَنْتَ كَمَا أَثْنَيْتَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oodhu biridhaaka min sakhatik, wa bimu'aafaatika min 'uqoobatik wa 'a'oodhu bika minka, laa 'uhsee thanaa'an 'alayka, 'Anta kamaa 'athnayta 'alaa nafsik
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek protection in Your pleasure from Your anger, and I seek protection in Your forgiveness from Your punishment. I seek protection in You from You. I cannot count Your praises. You are as You have praised Yourself.

sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said this prayer in salat or in prostration:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ فِي قَلْبِيْ نُورًا، وَفِي سَمْعِيْ نُورًا، وَفِي بَصَرِيْ نُورًا، وَعَنْ يَمِيْنِيْ نُورًا، وَعَنْ شِمَالِيْ نُورًا، وَأَمَامِيْ نُورًا، وَخَلْفِي نُورًا، وَفَوْقِيْ نُورًا، وَتَحْتِيْ نُورًا، وَاجْعَلْ لِي نُورًا (وَاجْعَلْنِيْ نُورًا)، وَاجْعَلْ فِي نَفْسِي نُورًا، (وَفِي عَصَبِيْ نُورًا، وَفِي لَحْمِي نُورًا، وَفِي دَمِيْ نُورًا، وَفِي شَعْرِيْ نُورًا، وَفِي بَشَرِيْ نُورًا)، اَللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِنِيْ نُورًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-maj'al fi qalbi nuran, wa fi sami' nuran, wa fi basari nuran, wa`an yamini nuran, wa`an shimaali nuran, wa amaami nuran, wa khalfi nuran, wa fawqi nuran, wa ta’hti nuran, waj`alli nuran (waj`alni nuran), waj`al fi nafsi nuran, (wa fi asabi nuran, wa fi lahmi nuran, wa fi dami nuran, wa fi sha’ri nuran, wa fi bashari nuran), Allaahumma a’tini nuran
sub_title.translation: O Allah, place light in my heart, and in my ears light and in my sight light, and to my right light, and to my left light, and before me light and behind me light, and above me light, and below me light. O Allah, Make for me light, and make me a light, and place in my soul light, and place light in my nerves, and in my flesh light and in my blood light and in my hair light and in my skin light. O Allah, grant me light.

sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَكَ اَللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَا وَبِحَمْدِكَ، اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaanaka Allaahumma Rabbanaa wa bihamdika Allahum-maghfir lee
sub_title.translation: Glory is to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise is Yours. O Allah, forgive me. [1]
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated from Aisha (RA), she said that according to the instructions of the Qur'an, [2] the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say this dua more and more in bowing down and prostration - (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say while bowing down and prostration:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبُّوحٌ، قُدُّوسٌ، رَبُّ الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالرُّوحِ
sub_title.transliteration: Subboohun, Quddoosun, Rabbul-malaa'ikati warrooh
sub_title.translation: Glory (to You), Most Holy (are You), Lord of the angels and the Spirit.

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), used to prostrate and say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ لَكَ سَجَدْتُ وَلَكَ أَسْلَمْتُ، وَبِكَ آمَنْتُ، سَجَدَ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ، وَصَوَّرَهُ، فَأَحْسَنَ صُوْرَتَهُ وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ، تَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma laka sajadtu wa laka 'aslamtu, wa bika 'aamantu sajada wajhiya lilladhee khalaqahu, wa sawwarahu fa'ahsana su-ratahu, wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu, tabaarakAllahu 'ahsanul-khaaliqeen
sub_title.translation: O Allah, to You I prostrate myselfm, to You I have submitted, and in You I believe. My face is prostrated to the One Who created it, fashioned it, and gave it hearing and sight. Blessed is Allah, the Best of creators.

sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ ذِي الْجَبَرُوتِ، وَالْمَلَكُوتِ، وَالْكِبْرِيَاءِ، وَالْعَظَمَةِ
sub_title.transliteration: Subhaana dhil-jabarooti, wal-malakooti, wal-kibriyaa'i, wal-'adhamah
sub_title.translation: Glory is to You, Master of power, of dominion, of majesty and greatness.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated by Awf ibn Malik al-Ashja'i (RA): I stood up to pray along with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ); he got up and recited Surat al-Baqarah (Surah 2). When he came to a verse which spoke of mercy, he stopped and made supplication, and when he came to verse which spoke of punishment, he stopped and sought refuge in Allah, then he bowed and paused as long as he stood (reciting Surah al-Baqarah) Then he prostrated and paused as long as he bowed down. In prostration he said- (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي، رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي
sub_title.transliteration: Rabbighfir lee, Rabbighfir lee
sub_title.translation: O My Lord, forgive me. My Lord, forgive me.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Huzaifa (RA) said that the Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite the above mentioned dua while sitting in the middle of two prostrations.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَارْحَمْنِي وَعَافِنِي وَاهْدِنِي وَارْزُقْنِي
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-maghfir lee, warhamnee, wa 'aafinee, wahdinee, warzuqnee
sub_title.translation: O Allah! Pardon me, have mercy on me, guide me, and grant me sustenance.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say this dua while sitting between two prostrations.

sub_title.duay: It is narrated on the authority of Abu Huraira (RA) The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) that when, the son of Adam recites the Ayat of Sajdah (prostration) and then falls down in prostration, the Satan goes into seclusion and weeps and says: Alas, and in the narration of Abu Kuraib the words are: Woe unto me, the son of Adam was commanded to prostrate, and he prostrated and Paradise was entitled to him and I was commanded to prostrate, but I refused and am doomed to Hell.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua in the prostration due to Quran recitation
sub_title.duay: Prophet (ﷺ) recited the verse of prostration and went to sujood and make this dua:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اكْتُبْ لِي بِهَا عِنْدَكَ أَجْرًا، وَضَعْ عَنِّي بِهَا وِزْرًا، وَاجْعَلْهَا لِي عِنْدَكَ ذُخْرًا، وَتَقَبَّلْهَا مِنِّي كَمَا تَقَبَّلْتَهَا مِنْ عَبْدِكَ دَاوُدَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-maktub lee bihaa ‘indaka ‘ajran, wada', ‘annee bihaa wizran, waj’alhaa lee ‘indaka dhukhran, wa taqabbalhaa minnee kamaa taqabbaltahaa min ’abdika Daawood
sub_title.translation: O Allah, write it as a reward for me, and release me from a sin for it, and make it a treasure for me in Paradise. Accept it from me as You accepted it from your servant Dawud.

sub_title.duay: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) recited the verses of prostration at night, he would go in prostration and say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: سَجَدَ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ، وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ بِحَوْلِهِ وَقُوَّتِهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Sajada wajhiya lilladhee khalaqahu, wa shaqqa sam'a-hu wa basarahu bi hawlihi wa quwwatih
sub_title.translation: I have prostrated my face to the One Who created it, and gave it hearing and sight by His might and His power.

sub_title.duay_arbi: سَجَدَ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّذِي خَلَقَهُ، وَشَقَّ سَمْعَهُ وَبَصَرَهُ بِحَوْلِهِ وَقُوَّتِهِ، فَتَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
sub_title.transliteration: Sajada wajhiya lilladhee khalaqahu, wa shaqqa sam'ahu wa basarahu bi hawlihi wa quwwatihi. FatabaarakAllahu 'ahsanul-khaaliqeen
sub_title.translation: I have prostrated my face to the One Who created it, and gave it hearing and sight by His might and His power. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلتَّحِيَّاتُ لِلَّهِ، وَالصَّلَوَاتُ، وَالطَّيِّبَاتُ، اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ، السَّلَامُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى عِبَادِ اللَّهِ الصَّالِحِينَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Attahiyyaatu lillaahi wassalawaatu, wattayyibaatu, assalaamu 'alayka 'ayyuhan-Nabiyyu wa rahmatullaahi wa barakaatuhu, assalaamu 'alaynaa wa 'alaa 'ibaadillaahis-saaliheen. 'Ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluhu
sub_title.translation: All greetings of humility are for Allah, and all prayers and goodness. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous slaves of Allah. I bear witness that there is none worthy of worship but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and His Messenger.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Tashahood was narrated by various companions (with different wordings). Ibn Mas'ud (RA) said, We used to pray behind the Prophet (ﷺ) and used to say: As-Salaamu 'Al-Allah. Peace be upon Allah. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, Allah himself is As-Salam (Name of Allah), so you should say: (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلتَّحِيَّاتُ الْمُبَارَكَاتُ الصَّلَوَاتُ الطَّيِّبَاتُ لِلَّهِ اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلَى عِبَادِ اللَّهِ الصَّالِحِينَ أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Attahiyyaatul muba’rakaatus salawaatut, tayyibaatu lillaahi, assalaamu 'alayka 'ayyuhan-Nabiyyu wa rahmatullaahi wa barakaatuhu, assalaamu 'alaynaa wa 'alaa 'ibaadillaahis-saaliheen. 'Ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadar Rasoolullaah.
sub_title.translation: All the blessed compliments and all the holy prayers are only for Allah. Peace be on you, O Prophet, and Allah’s mercy and blessings (are on you). And peace be on us and on the good (pious) worshipers of Allah.I bear witness that there is no true God except Allah. I further testify that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the Messenger of Allah.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلتَّحِيَّاتُ لِلَّهِ اَلزَّاكِيَاتُ لِلَّهِ، اَلطَّيِّبَاتُ الصَّلَوَتُ لِلَّهِ، اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهٗ، اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْنَا وَعَلٰى عِبَادِ اللَّهِ الصَّالِحِينَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَّا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهٗ ورَسُولُهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Attahiyyaatu lillaahi ajjakiyaatu lillaahi, Attayyibaatus salawaatu lillaahi, assalaamu 'alayka 'ayyuhan-Nabiyyu wa rahmatullaahi wa barakaatuhu, assalaamu 'alaynaa wa 'alaa 'ibaadillaahis-saaliheen. 'Ash-hadu 'an laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wa 'ash-hadu 'anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa Rasooluh.
sub_title.translation: All the blessed compliments, all the good deeds and all the holy prayers are only for Allah. Peace be on you, O Prophet, and Allah’s mercy and blessings (are on you). And peace be on us and on the good (pious) worshipers of Allah. I bear witness that there is no true God except Allah. I further testify that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the Messenger of Allah.

section.section_title: Prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) after tashahhud

sub_title.duay_title: Prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) after tashahhud #1
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَّعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَّجِيْدٌ اَللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَّعَلَى آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَى إِبْرَاهِيْمَ وَعَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَّجِيْدٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa sallayta 'alaa 'Ibraaheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed. Allaahumma baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'alaa 'aali Muhammadin, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'Ibraaheema wa 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema, 'innaka Hameedun Majeed
sub_title.translation: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad (ﷺ) and on the family of Muhammad as You have bestowed Your favor on Ibrahim and on the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious. O Allah, bless Muhammad (ﷺ) and the family of Muhammad as You have blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated by Ka`b bin Ujrah (RA): We asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, 'O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! How should one (ask Allah to) send blessings on you, the members of the family, for Allah has taught us how to salute you (in the prayer)?' He (ﷺ) said, 'Say: (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_title: Prayers upon the Prophet (ﷺ) after tashahhud #2
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَزْوَاجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ، كَمَا صَلَّيْتَ عَلَى آلِ إِبْرَاهِيْمَ، وَبَارِكْ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَزْوَاجِهِ وَذُرِّيَّتِهِ، كَمَا بَارَكْتَ عَلَى آلِ إبْرَاهِيْمَ إِنَّكَ حَمِيْدٌ مَجِيْدٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma salli 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'azwaajihi wa dhurriyyatihi, kamaa sallayta 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema. Wa baarik 'alaa Muhammadin wa 'azwaajihi wa dhurriyyatihi, kamaa baarakta 'alaa 'aali 'Ibraaheema. 'Innaka Hameedun Majeed
sub_title.translation: O Allah, bestow Your favor on Muhammad (ﷺ) and upon his wives and progeny as You have bestowed Your favor upon the family of Ibrahim. And bless Muhammad (ﷺ) and his wives and progeny as You have blessed the family of Ibrahim, You are full of praise, Most Glorious.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated Abu Hamid (RA) Saidi: They asked, “O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ)! How can we recite Durood for you?” Then the Prophet (ﷺ) said, you say - (The dua is mentioned above)

section.section_title: Duas after the last tashahhud & before salam

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَلِّفْ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِنَا وَأَصْلِحْ ذَاتَ بَيْنِنَا وَاهْدِنَا سُبُلَ السَّلَامِ وَنَجِّنَا مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّوْرِ وَجَنِّبْنَا الْفَوَاحِشَ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا وَمَا بَطَنَ وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي أَسْمَاعِنَا وَأَبْصَارِنَا وَقُلُوبِنَا وَأَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَا إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيْمُ وَاجْعَلْنَا شَاكِرِيْنَ لِنِعْمَتِكَ مُثْنِيْنَ بِهَا قَابِلِيْهَا وَأَتِمَّهَا عَلَيْنَا
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma allif bayna quloobinaa wa aslih dhaata bayninaa wahdinaa subulas salaam, wa najjinaa minaz zulumaati ilan noor, wa jannibnal fawaa-hisha maa zahara minhaa wa maa batan, wa baarik lanaa fi asmaa’inaa wa absaarinaa wa quloobinaa wa azwaajinaa wa dhurri yaatinaa wa tub alaynaa innaka antat tawwaabur raheem waj’alnaa shaakireena lini’matika muth-neena bihaa qaabileehaa wa atimmahaa 'alaynaa
sub_title.translation: O Allah, join our hearts, mend our social relationship, guide us to the path of peace, bring us from darkness to light, save us from obscenities, outward or inward, and bless our ears, our eyes, our hearts, our wives, our children, and relent toward us; Thou art the Relenting, the Merciful. And make us grateful for Thy blessing and make us praise it while accepting it and give it to us in full.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdullah ibn Mas'ud (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to teach us this dua to recite after Tashahhud.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ وَمِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oodhu bika min 'adhaabi jahannam, wa min 'adhaabil-qabr, wa min fitnatil-mahyaa wal-mamaati, wa min sharri fitnatil-maseehid-dajjaal
sub_title.translation: O Allah! I seek refuge with Thee from the torment of the Hell, from the torment of the grave, from the trial of life and death and from the evil of the trial of Masih al-Dajjal.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: When any one of you utters tashahhud (in prayer) he must seek refuge in Allah from four (trials) and should thus say : (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay: Rasulullah (ﷺ) used to say these words at the end of the prayer between Tashahhud and Salam:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي مَا قَدَّمْتُ وَمَا أَخَّرْتُ وَمَا أَسْرَرْتُ وَمَا أَعْلَنْتُ وَمَا أَسْرَفْتُ وَمَا أَنْتَ أَعْلَمُ بِهِ مِنِّي أَنْتَ الْمُقَدِّمُ وَأَنْتَ الْمُؤَخِّرُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahum-maghfir lee maa qaddamtu, wa maa 'akhkhartu, wa maa 'asrartu, wa maa 'a'lantu, wa maa 'asraftu, wa maa 'Anta 'a'lamu bihi minnee. 'Antal-Muqaddimu, wa 'Antal-Mu'akhkhiru laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta
sub_title.translation: O Allah, forgive me what I have sent before me and what I have left behind me, what I have concealed and what I have done openly, what I have done in excess, and what You are better aware of than I. You are the One Who sends forth and You are the One Who delays. There is none worthy of worship but You.
sub_title.duay_hadis: After tashahood, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) supplicate this dua at the end, before saying salaam.

sub_title.duay: Narrated by Abu Bakr As-Siddiq (RA): I asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) to teach me a dua so that I may invoke Allah with it in my prayer. He told me to say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ ظُلْمًا كَثِيْرًا وَلَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ فَاغْفِرْ لِي مَغْفِرَةً مِنْ عِنْدِكَ وَارْحَمْنِيْ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفُوْرُ الرَّحِيْمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee dhalamtu nafsee dhulman katheeran, wa laa yaghfirudh-dhunooba 'illaa 'Anta, faghfir lee maghfiratan min 'indika warhamnee 'innaka 'Antal-Ghafoorur-Raheem
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself and no one forgives sins but You. So, grant me forgiveness and have mercy on me. Surely, you are Forgiving, Merciful.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ بِعِلْمِكَ الْغَيْبَ وَقُدْرَتِكَ عَلَى الْخَلْقِ أَحْيِنِيْ مَا عَلِمْتَ الْحَيَاةَ خَيْرًا لِي وَتَوَفَّنِيْ إِذَا عَلِمْتَ الْوَفَاةَ خَيْرًا لِي اَللَّهُمَّ وَأَسْأَلُكَ خَشْيَتَكَ فِي الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ وَأَسْأَلُكَ كَلِمَةَ الْحَقِّ فِي الرِّضَا وَالْغَضَبِ وَأَسْأَلُكَ الْقَصْدَ فِي الْفَقْرِ وَالْغِنَى وَأَسْأَلُكَ نَعِيْمًا لَا يَنْفَدُ وَأَسْأَلُكَ قُرَّةَ عَيْنٍ لَا تَنْقَطِعُ وَأَسْأَلُكَ الرِّضَا بَعْدَ الْقَضَاءِ وَأَسْأَلُكَ بَرْدَ الْعَيْشِ بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ وَأَسْأَلُكَ لَذَّةَ النَّظَرِ إِلَى وَجْهِكَ وَالشَّوْقَ إِلَى لِقَائِكَ فِي غَيْرِ ضَرَّاءَ مُضِرَّةٍ وَلَا فِتْنَةٍ مُضِلَّةٍ اَللَّهُمَّ زَيِّنَا بِزِيْنَةِ الْإِيْمَانِ وَاجْعَلْنَا هُدَاةً مُهْتَدِيْنَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma bi'ilmikal-ghayba wa qudratika 'alal-khalq, 'ahyinee maa 'alimtal-hayaata khayran lee wa tawaffanee 'idhaa 'alimtal-wafaata khayran lee, Allaahumma wa 'as'aluka khashyataka fil-ghaybi wash-shahaadati, wa 'as'aluka kalimatal-haqqi fir-ridhaa wal-ghadhabi, wa 'as'alukal-qasda fil-faqri walghinaa, wa 'as'aluka na'eeman laa yanfadu, wa 'as'aluka qurrata 'aynin laa tanqati'u, wa 'as'alukar-ridhaa ba'dal-qadhaa, wa 'as'aluka bardal-'ayshi ba'dal-mawti, wa 'as'aluka ladh-dhatan-nadhari 'ilaa wajhika wash-shawqa 'ilaa liqaa'ika fee ghayri darraa'a mudirratin wa laa fitnatin mudillatin, Allaahumma zayyinnaa bizeenatil-'eemaani waj'alnaa hudaatan muhtadeen
sub_title.translation: O Allah, by Your Knowledge of the unseen and by Your Power over creation, let me live if You know that life is good for me, and let me die if You know that death is good for me. O Allah, I ask You to grant me fear of You in private and in public. I ask you for the word of truth in times of contentment and anger. I ask You for moderation in wealth and in poverty. I ask you for blessings never ceasing and the coolness of my eye (i .e . pleasure) that never ends. I ask You for pleasure after Your Judgment and I ask You for a life of coolness after death. I ask You for the delight of gazing upon Your Face and the joy of meeting You without any harm and misleading trials befalling me. O Allah, dress us with the beauty of Faith, and make us guides who are upon (correct) guidance.
sub_title.duay_hadis: It was narrated from Ata bn As-Sa'ib (R) that: Ammar bin Yasir (RA) led us in prayer and he made it brief. Some of the people said to him: 'You made the prayer short.He said: 'Nevertheless I still recited supplications that I heard from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ).' Saying this, he taught them the above dua.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ كُلِّهِ عَاجِلِهِ وَآجِلِهِ، مَا عَلِمْتُ مِنْهُ وَمَا لَمْ أَعْلَمْ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الشَّرِّ كُلِّهِ عَاجِلِهِ وَآجِلِهِ، مَا عَلِمْتُ مِنْهُ وَمَا لَمْ أَعْلَمْ، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ مِنْ خَيْرِ مَا سَأَلَكَ عَبْدُكَ وَنَبِيُّكَ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا عَاذَ بِهِ عَبْدُكَ وَنَبِيُّكَ، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ وَمَا قَرَّبَ إِلَيْهَا مِنْ قَوْلٍ أَوْ عَمَلٍ، وَأَسْأَلُكَ أَنْ تَجْعَلَ كُلَّ قَضَاءٍ قَضَيْتَهُ لِي خَيْرًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as'aluka minal-khayri kullihi, 'aajilihi wa aajilihi, maa 'alimtu minhu wa maa lam a'lam. Wa A‛oodhu bika minash-sharri kullihi, 'aajilihi wa aajilihi, maa 'alimtu minhu wa maa lam a'lam. Allaahumma inni as'aluka min khayri maa sa'alaka 'abduka wa nabiyyuka, wa A‛oodhu bika min sharri maa 'aadha bihi 'abduka wa nabiyyuka. Allaahumma inni as'alukal-jannata wa maa qarraba ilayhaa min qawlin aw 'amal, wa A‛oodhu bika minan-naari wa maa qarraba ilayhaa min qawlin aw 'amal, wa as'aluka an taj'al kulla qadaa'in qadaytahu li khayra
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You for all that is good, in this world and in the Hereafter, what I know and what I do not know. O Allah, I seek refuge with You from all evil, in this world and in the Hereafter, what I know and what I do not know. O Allah, I ask You for the good that Your slave and Prophet (ﷺ) has asked You for, and I seek refuge with You from the evil from which Your slave and Prophet (ﷺ) sought refuge. O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and for that which brings one closer to it, in word and deed, and I seek refuge in You from Hell and from that which brings one closer to it, in word and deed. And I ask You to make every decree that You decree concerning me good.

sub_title.duay: Protection from punishment of the grave, trials of life, death & Dajjal, from sin & debt:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْـيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ. اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْمَأْثَمِ وَالْمَغْرَمِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oodhu bika min 'adhaabil-qabr, wa 'a'oodhu bika min fitnatil-maseehid-dajjaal, wa 'a'oodhu bika min fitnatil-mahyaa wal-mamaat. Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oodhu bika minal-ma'thami wal-maghram
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and I seek refuge in You from the trial of the False Messiah, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of life and death. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from sin and from debt.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated by `Aisha (RA) (the wife of the Prophet) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to say this dua in the prayer. She said to him, Why do you so frequently seek refuge with Allah from being in debt? The Prophet (ﷺ) replied, A person who in debt tells lies whenever he speaks, and breaks promises whenever he makes (them).

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيْحِ الدَّجَّالِ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ. اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْمَأْثَمِ وَمِنَ الْمَغْرَمِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni a`udhu bika min `adhaabi jahannam, wa a`udhu bika min `adhaabil-qabr, wa a`udhu bika min fitnatil-masihid-dajjaal, wa a`udhu bika min fitnatil-mahyaa wal-mamaat, Allaahumma inni a`udhu bika minal-ma'thami wa minal-maghram
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge with Thee from the torment of Hell, and I seek refuge with Thee from the torment of the grave, and I seek refuge with Thee from the trial of the Masih al-Dajjal (Antichrist) and I seek refuge with Thee from the trial of life and death. O Allah! I seek refuge with Thee from sin and debt.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ibn ‘Abbas (RA) said that the Holy Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach them (the Companions) this Dua in the same way he used to teach them Surah of the Quran. He used to say: (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ، وَشُكْرِكَ، وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'a'innee 'alaa dhikrika, wa shukrika, wahusni 'ibaadatik
sub_title.translation: O Allah, help me to remember You, to give You thanks, and to perform Your worship in the best manner.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Mu'adh bin Jabal (RA) reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) caught his hand and said: By Allah, I love you, Mu'adh. By Allah, I love you. I give some instruction to you. Never leave to recite this supplication after every (prescribed) prayer: (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبُخْلِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْجُبْنِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ أَنْ نُرَدَّ إِلَى أَرْذَلِ الْعُمُرِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الدُّنْيَا وَعَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'a'oodhu bika minal-bukhli, wa 'a'oodhu bika minal-jubni, wa 'a'oodhu bika min 'an nuradda 'ilaa 'ardhalil-'umuri, wa 'a'oodhu bika min fitnatid-dunyaa wa 'adhaabil-qabr
sub_title.translation: O Allah! I seek refuge with You from cowardice, and miserliness, and seek refuge with You from reaching a degraded helpless old age, and seek refuge with You from the afflictions of the world and from the punishment in the grave.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated by Saad Ibn Abi Waqqas (RA): Saad (RA) used to teach these words to his sons in the same way that a teacher teaches handwriting to children. And he used to say that towards the end of the prayer, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would seek refuge (in Allah) in these matters: (The dua is mentioned above)

sub_title.duay: Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA): He said: The Prophet (ﷺ) said to a person: what do you say in prayer? He replied: I first recite tashahhud (supplication recited in sitting position), and then I say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'alukal-jannata wa 'a'oodhu bika minan-naar
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and seek Your protection from the Fire.
sub_title.duay_hadis: I can't recite dua as beautifully as you do, not even as Mu'adh! Then the Prophet (ﷺ) said, Our dua also carries meaning close to it!

sub_title.duay: Narrated by Mizan Ibn Arda (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) entered the mosque. Then a person is reciting Tashahhud towards the end of the prayer. He says:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ يَا أَللَّهُ بِأَنَّكَ الْوَاحِدُ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ الَّذِي لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ، أَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِي ذُنُوبِي إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka yaaAllahu bi'annakal-Waahidul-'Ahadus-Samadul-ladhee, lam yalid wa lam yoolad, wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'Ahad, 'an taghfira lee dhunoobee 'innaka 'Antal-Ghafoorur-Raheem
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You. O Allah, You are the One, the Only, Self-Sufficient Master, Who was not begotten and begets not and none is equal to Him. Forgive me my sins, surely you are Forgiving, Merciful.
sub_title.duay_hadis: After hearing his supplication, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said three times, He has been forgiven

sub_title.duay: It was narrated that Anas bin Malik (RA) said: I was sitting with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and a man was standing and praying. When he bowed, prostrated and recited the tashahhud, he supplicated, and in his supplication he said:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ الْمَنَّانُ، بَدِيعُ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee as’aluka bi anna lakal-hamda laa ilaaha illaa anta al-mannaanu, badee‛-us-samawaati wal-ardi yaa dhal-jalaali wal-ikraam, yaa hayyu yaa qayyoomu, inne as’aluka
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You as unto You is all praise, none has the right to be worshipped except You, alone, without partner. You are the Benefactor. Originator of the heavens and the Earth, O Possessor of majesty and honour, O Ever Living, O Self-Subsisting and Supporter of all. I am asking you
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Do you know what he has supplicated with?' They said: Allah (SWT) and His Messenger know best. He (ﷺ) said: 'By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, he called upon Allah by His greatest Name, which, if He is called by it, He responds, and if He is asked by it, He gives.'

sub_title.duay: Buraidah ibn husaib (RA) said: The Prophet (ﷺ) heard a man supplicating, and he was saying:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنِّي اَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ الَّذِيْ لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُوْلَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka bi'annee 'ash-hadu 'annaka 'AntAllahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Antal-'Ahadus-Samadul-ladhee lam yalid wa lam yoolad wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'Ahad
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You, by the fact that I bear witness that You are Allah. There is none worthy of worship but You, the Only ilah, Independent of creation, Who was not begotten and begets not, and none is equal to Him.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Then the Prophet (ﷺ) said, ‘By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, he has asked Allah by His Greatest Name, the one which if He is called upon by it, He responds, and when He is asked by it, He gives.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، الْمَنَّانُ، يَا بَدِيعَ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka bi'anna lakal-hamdu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Anta wahdaka laa shareeka laka, Al-Mannaanu, yaa Badee'as-samawaati wal'ardhi yaa dhal-Jalaali wal-'Ikraam, yaa Hayyu yaa Qayyoomu 'innee 'as'alukal-jannata wa 'a'oodhu bika minan-naar
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You, as You are the Owner of praise, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partner. You are the Giver of all good. O Creator of the heavens and the earth, Owner of majesty and honor. O Living and Everlasting One, I ask you for Paradise and I seek refuge in You from the fire.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْجُبْنِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَرَمِ، وَأَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْبُخْلِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee A‛oodhu bika minal kasali, wa A‛oodhu bika minal jubni, wa A‛oodhu bika minal harami, wa A‛oodhu bika minal bukhl.
sub_title.translation: O Allah! I seek refuge with You from laziness, and seek refuge with You from cowardice, and seek refuge with You from geriatric old age, and seek refuge with You from miserliness.

sub_title.duay: Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (RA) reported: While we were praying with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), one among the people said:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيْرًا، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيرًا، وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu 'Akbar Kabiran, walhamdu lillaahi kathiran, wa Subhaanallahi bukratan wa'asila
sub_title.translation: Allah is the Greatest, Most Great. Praise is to Allah, abundantly. Glory is to Allah, at the break of day and at its end.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Who uttered such and such a word? A person among the people (who have recited these words) said: Me! Ya Messenger of Allah!. He (ﷺ) said: it's utterance surprised me because for this dua, the doors of heaven were opened. Ibn 'Umar (RA) said: I have not abandoned them (to recite this dua) since I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying this.

sub_title.duay_title: If you sneeze during the prayer
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ حَمْدًا كَثِيرًا طَيِّبًا مُبَارَكًا فِيهِ مُبَارَكًا عَلَيْهِ كَمَا يُحِبُّ رَبُّنَا وَيَرْضَى
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdulillaahi hamdan kathiran tayyiban mubaarakan fih, mubarakan 'alayhi, kama yuhibbu rabbuna wa yarda.
sub_title.translation: Praise be to Allah, much good and blessed praise as our Lord loves and is pleased with.

sub_title.duay: Umm Salamah (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say these words after the salutation, at the end of the Fajr prayer.
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma innee as’aluka ‛ilman naafi‛an, warizqan tayyiban, wa ‛amalan mutaqabbalaa
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You for knowledge which is beneficial and sustenance which is good, and deeds which are acceptable.

sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha ill-Allahu, wa'hdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-'hamdu, yu'hyee wa yumeetu, wa huwa ‛alaa kulli shay’in qadeer
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, who is alone and does not have any partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise, He gives life and causes death and He is omnipotent over all things.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَجِرْنِيْ مِنَ النَّارِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma Ajirni minan-naar
sub_title.translation: O Allah, protect me from Hell.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Harith ibn Muslim (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me: When you finish the maghrib prayer, say: 'O Allah, protect me from Hell seven times; for if you say that and die that night, Allah will protect you from jahannam; and when you finish the fajr prayer, say it in a similar way, for if you die that day, Allah will protect you from jahannam. Most of the muhaddithin have considered this hadith to be acceptable.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to be recited after salaam #1
sub_title.duay: Say three times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ
sub_title.transliteration: Astaghfirullaah
sub_title.translation: I ask Allah for forgiveness.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to be recited after salaam #2
sub_title.duay: Thauban (RA) said that Rasulullah (ﷺ) used to say after saying istighfar three times after the prayer:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلَامُ وَمِنْكَ السَّلَامُ تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'Antas-Salaam wa minkas-salaam, tabaarakta yaa Dhal-Jalaali wal-'Ikraam
sub_title.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of majesty and honor.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to be recited after salaam #3
sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say this dua after every compulsory prayer:
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، اَللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلَا مُعْطِىَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha ill-Allahu wa'hdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-'hamdu wa huwa ‛alaa kulli shay’in qadeer, Allaahumma laa maani‛a li maa a‛tayta, wa laa mu‛tiya li maa mana‛ta wa laa yanfa‛u dhal-jaddi minkal-jaddu
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and and He is Able to do all things. O Allah, none can prevent what You have willed to bestow and none can bestow what You have willed to prevent, and no wealth or majesty can benefit anyone, as from You is all wealth and majesty.

sub_title.duay_title: Dua to be recited after salaam #4
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَلَا نَعْبُدُ إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ لَهُ النِّعْمَةُ وَلَهُ الْفَضْلُ وَلَهُ الثَّنَاءُ الْحَسَنُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ مُخْلِصِيْنَ لَهُ الدِّيْنَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْكَافِرُوْنَ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa ilaaha ill-Allahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa huwa ‛alaa kulli shay’in qadeer, laa hawla wa laa quwwata illaa billaah, laa ilaaha ill-Allahu, wa laa na‛budu illaa iyyaahu, lahun-ni‛matu wa lahul-fadlu wa lahuth-thanaa’-ul-hasan, laa ilaaha ill-Allahu, mukhliseena lahud-deena wa law karihal-kaafiroon
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and and He is Able to do all things, there is no might nor power except with Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah and we worship none except Him. For Him is all favor, grace, and glorious praise. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah and we are sincere in faith and devotion to Him although the disbelievers detest it.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdullah ibn Zubayr (RA) himself used to recite this dua after every salaam and say: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite these dua after every prayer.

sub_title.duay: After every prescribed salat, Ayatul Kursi should be recited:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللّٰهُ لَآ إِلٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَىُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُۥ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَّهُۥ مَا فِى السَّمٰوٰتِ وَمَا فِى الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَـُٔودُهُۥ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِىُّ الْعَظِيمُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa Huwal-Hayyul-Qayyoom, laa ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa laa nawm, lahu maa fis-samaawaati wa maa fil-'ardhi, man dhal-ladhee yashfa'u 'indahu 'illaa bi'idhnihi, ya'lamu maa bayna 'aydeehim wa maa khalfahum, wa laa yuheetoona bishay'im-min 'ilmihi 'illaa bimaa shaa'a, wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samaawaati wal 'ardh, wa laa ya'ooduhu hifdhuhumaa, wa Huwal-'Aliyyul- 'Adheem
sub_title.translation: Allah! There is none worthy of worship but He, the Ever Living, the One Who sustains and protects all that exists. Neither slumber nor sleep overtakes Him. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is he that can intercede with Him except with His Permission? He knows what happens to them in this world, and what will happen to them in the Hereafter. And they will never compass anything of His Knowledge except that which He wills. His Throne extends over the heavens and the earth, and He feels no fatigue in guarding and preserving them. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, Whoever recites Ayatul Kursi immediately after each prescribed prayer, there will be nothing standing between him and his entering Paradise except death.

sub_title.duay_title: Surah Ikhlas, Surah Falaq and Surah Nas
sub_title.duay: Surah Nas One Times:
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّـهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوْذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ ﴿١﴾ مَلِكِ النَّاسِ ﴿٢﴾ إِلَـٰهِ النَّاسِ ﴿٣﴾ مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ ﴿٤﴾ الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ ﴿٥﴾ مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ ﴿٦﴾
sub_title.transliteration: Bismillaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem. (1) Qul 'A'oodhu birabbin-naas. (2) Malikin-naas. (3) 'Ilaahin-naas. (4) Min sharril-waswaasil-khannaas. (5) Allathee yuwaswisu fee sudoorin-naas. (6) Minal-jinnati wannaas
sub_title.translation: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful. (1) Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, (2) The Sovereign of mankind. (3) The God of mankind, (4) From the evil of the retreating whisperer - (5) Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - (6) From among the jinn and mankind. (Sura Nas: 1-6)
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite surah ikhlaas, falaaq and naas once after every obligatory prayer. [1] After magrib and 'ishaa prayer he used to recite three times. [2]
sub_title.reference: [1] Sahih (Albani). Abu Dawud: 1523 [2] Hasan (Albani). Abu Dawud: 5082

sub_title.duay: Transliteration: Allahu 'Akbar
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu 'Akbar
sub_title.translation: Allah is the greatest.
sub_title.duay_hadis: 33 times Subhanallah, 33 times Alhamdulillah and 34 times Allahu Akbar. These have been mentioned in different numbers in different sahih hadiths. The number above is more famous. Maximum number 400 times; Subhanallah, Alhamdulillah, Allahu Akbar and La-ilaha illallah - do 100 dhikr every time. Minimum number 30 times; 10 times Subhanallah, 10 times Alhamdulillah and 10 times Allahu Akbar

sub_title.duay_title: Sins forgiven even if like the foam of the sea
sub_title.duay: Say thirty-three times each:
sub_title.duay_arbi: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illAllahu wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, lahul-mulku walahul-hamdu wahuwa 'alaa kulli shay'in Qadeer
sub_title.translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner, to Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Whoever says these after every prayer will be forgiven his sins even though they be as the foam of the sea.

sub_title.duay_title: The greatness of dua after Fajr prayer #1
sub_title.duay: Anas bin Malik (RA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Whoever prays Fajr in congregation, then sits and remembering Allah until the sun has risen, then he prays two Rak'ah, then for him is the reward like that of a Hajj and Umrah. He said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Complete, complete, complete (Hajj and Umrah).

sub_title.duay_title: The greatness of dua after Fajr prayer #2
sub_title.duay: Simak ibn Harb (RA) reported: I said to Jabir bin Samura (RA): Did you sit in the company of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ? He said: Yes, many times. He (ﷺ) used to sit at the place where he observed the Fajr or Maghrib prayer till the sun rose or when it had risen; he would stand, and they (his Companions) would talk about matters (pertaining to the days) of Jahiliyyah, and they would laugh (on these matters) while (the Prophet ﷺ) only smiled.

sub_title.duay_title: How to reply to specific ayaat in Salah #1
sub_title.duay: Reply to specific ayah inside prayer, for both the imam and the followers, both the reciter and the one who is listening the recitation #1
sub_title.duay_hadis: Sheikh Albani (R) said that, this rule is general. Because of this this rule include inside or outside prayer and obligatory or voluntary prayer. Sabbi'hisma rabbikal a'la (Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High) The messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to reply this ayah by saying this, Sub’hana rabbiyal a’la (Glory is to my Lord, the Most High) [1] The messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said that, who recite this ayah from sura Qiyaamah, Alaisa zaalika biqaadirin an iyu'hyaal mawta (Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?) He should reply this by saying this, Sub’hanaka fabalaa (Glory be to you! Yes! You are able to give life to the dead) [2]
sub_title.reference: [1] Ahmad, Abu Daud: 883, Sahih (Albani) [2] Bayhaqi, Abu Daud: 884, Sahih (Albani)

sub_title.duay_title: How to reply to specific ayaat in Salah #2
sub_title.duay: Reply to specific ayah inside prayer, for both the imam and the followers, both the reciter and the one who is listening the recitation #1
sub_title.duay_hadis: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) told us to reply this ayah of Surah Rahman Fabi ayyi alaa-i rabbikumaa tukazzibaan. Meaning: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? by this - laa bishaayim min ni'amika rabbanaa nukazzibu falakal 'hamd Meaning: Ya Rabb! We don't disbelief any of your favour and all praise belongs only to you. It is to mentioned that, In the end of surah tin replying by saying “baala wa ana ‘ala dhalika minash shahidiin” and in the end of sura mursalat replying by saying “Amanna billah” and in the end of surah bakarah replying by saying “Amin” - these reports are weak narration.

sub_title.duay: When you start something, eating,drinking,writing, reading something start saying ‘Bismillah’ -
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Bismillaah
sub_title.translation: In the Name of Allah.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Narrated 'Umar ibn Abi Salamah (RA): I was a boy under the care of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). While eating, I would put my hands in different places of the pot. Then the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me, “This boy! Say Bismillah, eat, and the next part of your right to eat! After the meal, I'm going to follow the instructions.

sub_title.duay_title: Intended to do something in the future
sub_title.duay_arbi: إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ
sub_title.transliteration: inshaa'Allah
sub_title.translation: If Allah wills.
sub_title.duay_hadis: And never say of anything, Indeed, I will do that tomorrow, Except [when adding], If Allah wills. And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct

sub_title.duay_title: If you see any Superiority, Highness, or Greatness of Allah
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu Akbaar
sub_title.translation: Allah is great.

sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Sub’hanallah
sub_title.translation: How perfect Allah is

sub_title.duay_title: Eating something good / listening to the good news
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaah
sub_title.translation: All praise is for Allah.
sub_title.duay_hadis: It was narrated from Anas that : the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: 'Allah does not bestow a blessing upon any slave and he says: 'Al-hamdu Lillah (praise is to Allah),' except that what he gives (the praise) is better than what he received (the blessing)

sub_title.duay: Hearing of danger or something bad news, when something is lost, or something is stolen or in trouble
sub_title.duay_arbi: إِنَّا لِلَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Innaa lillaahi
sub_title.translation: We are from Allah.

sub_title.duay_title: An expression of appreciation/seeing something good
sub_title.duay_arbi: مَا شَاءَ ٱللَّهُ
sub_title.transliteration: ma sha Allah
sub_title.translation: That which Allah wanted.

sub_title.duay_arbi: جَزَاكَ اللَّهُ خَيْرًا
sub_title.transliteration: JazaakAllahu khayran
sub_title.translation: May Allah reward you with good. [1]
sub_title.duay_hadis: We have seen that the believer never expects gratitude or recompense from anyone who benefits him. On the other hand, it is the duty of the beneficent believer to express gratitude to the benefactor, to praise him, to openly acknowledge his beneficence, and to pray for him. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: If someone does good to someone and he gives thanks to the benefactor by saying this, then it will be best appreciated. [2]

sub_title.duay: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, If one of you sneezes, let him say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaah
sub_title.translation: All praise is for Allah. [1]
sub_title.duay_hadis: After sneezing 'Alhamdu lillahi 'ala qulli ha-l'. have to be said or at least say 'Al-Hamdulillah', 'reference': [1] Bukhari: 6224 [2] Sahih (Albani). Tirmidhi: 2741

sub_title.duay_title: If you hear the sneezer say (Alhamdulillah), the listener will say -
sub_title.duay_arbi: يَرْحَمُكَ اللَّهُ
sub_title.transliteration: Yarhamuk-Allah
sub_title.translation: May Allah have mercy upon you.

sub_title.duay_arbi: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ
sub_title.transliteration: astaghfir-ullaah
sub_title.translation: I seek Allah’s forgiveness.
sub_title.duay_hadis: So know, [O Muhammad], that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows of your movement and your resting place.

sub_title.duay_title: In response to How are you?
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaah
sub_title.translation: All praise is for Allah.

sub_title.duay_title: If something unpleasant happens/hearing bad things
sub_title.duay: If you hear any bad words or if you hear or remember the punishment and wrath of Allah-
sub_title.duay_arbi: نَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: NA‛oodhu billaah
sub_title.translation: I seek refuge with Allah.

sub_title.duay_arbi: إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُوْنَ
sub_title.transliteration: Innaa lillaahi wa 'innaa 'ilayhi raaji'oon
sub_title.translation: We are from Allah and unto Him we return.

sub_title.duay_title: At the end of the prayer
sub_title.duay_arbi: آمِينْ
sub_title.transliteration: Aamin
sub_title.translation: (Oh Allah) accept our invocation.
sub_title.reference: Sahih Lee Ghairihi (Albani). Targib wat Tarhib, 2/66

sub_title.duay: Narrated Jabir bin Abdillah (RA): He said, 'When we ascended, we would say:
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu Akbaar
sub_title.translation: Allah is great.

sub_title.duay: And when descend, we said -
sub_title.duay_arbi: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ
sub_title.transliteration: Sub’hanallah
sub_title.translation: How perfect Allah is.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Can be read while going up and down the stairs/elevator

sub_title.duay_arbi: وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ‏
sub_title.transliteration: Wallahu a'lam
sub_title.translation: Allah knows better.

sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Bismillaahi wAllahu 'Akbar
sub_title.translation: With the Name of Allah, Allah is the Most Great!
sub_title.duay_hadis: Anas (RA) said that the Prophet (ﷺ) placed his feet on the two jaws of a goat with white and black horns and sacrificed him saying Bismillahi wAllahu akbar.

sub_title.duay_title: After winning or hope to win
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
sub_title.transliteration: Allahu Akbaar
sub_title.translation: Allah is great.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَلسَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكَاتُهُ
sub_title.transliteration: As-salaamu 'alaykum wara'hmatullaahi wa barakaatuh
sub_title.translation: Peace be upon you, and the Mercy of Allah and His Blessings.
sub_title.duay_hadis: A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said: As-salaamu 'alaykum! He responded to his salutation. He then sat down. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: Ten. Another man came and said: As-salaamu 'alaykum wara'hmatullaah! He responded to his salutation when he sat down. He said: Twenty. Another man came and said: As-salaamu 'alaykum wara'hmatullaahi wa barakaatuh! He responded to him and said when he sat down: Thirty.

sub_title.duay_title: To avoid Satan's whispers or deceptions
sub_title.duay_arbi: أَعُوْذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ
sub_title.transliteration: A'oodhu billaahi minash-Shaytaanir-rajeem
sub_title.translation: I seek refuge in Allah from Satan the outcast.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَاجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَيْنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَا أُمَّةً مُّسْلِمَةً لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord! Make of us Muslims, bowing to Thy (Will), and of our progeny a people Muslim, bowing to Thy (will); and show us our place for the celebration of (due) rites; and turn unto us (in Mercy); for Thou art the Oft-Returning, Most Merciful

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا آتِنَا فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord! Grant us good in this world and good in the hereafter, and save us from the chastisement of the fire

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَانصُرْنَا عَلَى القَوْمِ الكَافِرِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord! Bestow on us endurance, make our foothold sure, and give us help against the disbelieving folk

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذْنَا إِن نَّسِينَا أَوْ أَخْطَأْنَا
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحْمِلْ عَلَيْنَا إِصْرًا كَمَا حَمَلْتَهُ عَلَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِنَا
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلْنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِ ۖ وَاعْفُ عَنَّا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا ۚ أَنتَ مَوْلَانَا فَانصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغْ قُلُوبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِنْ لَّدُنْكَ رَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْوَهَّابُ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ النَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ الْمِيعَادَ ‎﴿٩﴾‏
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا بِمَا أَنزَلْتَ وَاتَّبَعْنَا الرَّسُولَ فَاكْتُبْنَا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger, so register us among the witnesses [to truth].

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَإِسْرَافَنَا فِي أَمْرِنَا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَانصُرْنَا عَلَى الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقْتَ هَـٰذَا بَاطِلًا سُبْحَانَكَ فَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ ﴿١٩١﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ مَن تُدْخِلِ النَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُ ۖ وَمَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ مِنْ أَنصَارٍ ﴿١٩٢﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَّبَّنَا إِنَّنَا سَمِعْنَا مُنَادِيًا يُنَادِي لِلْإِيمَانِ أَنْ آمِنُوا بِرَبِّكُمْ فَآمَنَّا
sub_title.translation: (193) Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَكَفِّرْ عَنَّا سَيِّئَاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ الْأَبْرَارِ ﴿١٩٣﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die with the righteous.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَآتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلَىٰ رُسُلِكَ وَلَا تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ ۗ إِنَّكَ لَا تُخْلِفُ الْمِيعَادَ ﴿١٩٤﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاكْتُبْنَا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, we have believed, so register us among the witnesses.

sub_title.duay_arbi: وَارْزُقْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ
sub_title.translation: And provide for us, and You are the best of providers.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَا أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people.

sub_title.duay_arbi: عَلَى اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا افْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْفَاتِحِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You].

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِّلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ ﴿٨٥﴾ وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الْكَافِرِينَ ﴿٨٦﴾
sub_title.translation: (85) Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people (86) And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ تَعْلَمُ مَا نُخْفِي وَمَا نُعْلِنُ ۗ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ مِن شَيْءٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ ‎﴿٣٨﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِي ۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَاءِ
sub_title.translation: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الْحِسَابُ ﴿٤١﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day when the account is established.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا آتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًا
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا نَخَافُ أَن يَفْرُطَ عَلَيْنَا أَوْ أَن يَطْغَىٰ ‎﴿٤٥﴾‏
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا ﴿٦٥﴾ إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا ﴿٦٦﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering (66) Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٌ شَكُورٌ ‎﴿٣٤﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَسِعْتَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ رَّحْمَةً وَعِلْمًا فَاغْفِرْ لِلَّذِينَ تَابُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا سَبِيلَكَ وَقِهِمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا وَأَدْخِلْهُمْ جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ الَّتِي وَعَدتَّهُمْ وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنْ آبَائِهِمْ وَأَزْوَاجِهِمْ وَذُرِّيَّاتِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ ‎﴿٨﴾‏ وَقِهِمُ السَّيِّئَاتِ ۚ وَمَن تَقِ السَّيِّئَاتِ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَقَدْ رَحِمْتَهُ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ ‎﴿٩﴾
sub_title.translation: (8) Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. (9) And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَانِنَا الَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِالْإِيمَانِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِي قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ ﴿٤﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا رَبَّنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ ﴿٥﴾
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

sub_title.duay_arbi: رَبَّنَا أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
sub_title.translation: Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent.

sub_title.duay: Narrated Anas: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to say when he entered the toilet:
sub_title.duay_arbi: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْخُبُثِ وَالْخَبَائِثِ
sub_title.transliteration: Bismillaah, Allaahumma 'innee 'A'oodhu bika minal-khubuthi walkhabaa'ith
sub_title.translation: In the Name of Allah. O Allah, I seek protection in You from the male and female unclean spirits.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ali (RA) said, Rasoolullah (ﷺ) said: When one of you goes to a secluded place by the call of nature, the covering of the genitals of the children of Adam from the eyes of the jinn is to say Bismillah.

sub_title.duay: It is narrated on the authority of Aisha (RA) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to say when he came out of the toilet:
sub_title.duay_arbi: غُفْرَانَكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Gufraanak
sub_title.translation: I ask You (Allah) for forgiveness.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Ayesha (RA) said that Rasoolullah (ﷺ) used to say this dua when he came out of the toilet.

section.section_title: Duas by the name of Allah

sub_title.duay_title: Dua by the name of Allah
sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي عَبْدُكَ وَابْنُ عَبْدِكَ وَابْنُ أَمَتِكَ، نَاصِيَتِي بِيَدِكَ، مَاضٍ فِيَّ حُكْمُكَ، عَدْلٌ فِيَّ قَضَاؤُكَ، أَسْأَلُكَ بِكُلِّ اسْمٍ هُوَ لَكَ، سَمَّيْتَ بِهِ نَفْسَكَ، أَوْ أَنْزَلْتَهُ فِي كِتَبِكَ، أَوْ عَلَّمْتَهُ أَحَدًا مِنْ خَلْقِكَ، أَوِ اسْتَأْثَرْتَ بِهِ فِي عِلْمِ الْغَيْبِ عِنْدَكَ، أَنْ تَجْعَلَ الْقُرْآنَ رَبِيْعَ قَلْبِي، وَنُوْرَ بَصَرِيْ (وَنُورَ صَدْرِي)، وَجَلَاءَ حُزْنِيْ، وَذَهَابَ هَمِّيْ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'abduka, wabnu 'abdika, wabnu 'amatika, naasiyatee biyadika, maadhin fiyya hukmuka, 'adlun fiyya qadhaa'uka, 'as'aluka bikulli ismin huwa laka, sammayta bihi nafsaka, 'aw 'anzaltahu fee kitaabika, 'aw 'allamtahu 'ahadan min khalqika, 'aw ista'tharta bihi fee 'ilmil-ghaybi 'indaka, 'an taj'alal-Qur'aana rabee'a qalbee, wa noora basaree (in another narration it is 'sadree' instead of 'basaree'), wa jalaa'a huznee, wa dhahaaba hammee
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I am Your slave and the son of Your male slave and the son of your female slave. My forehead is in Your Hand (i.e. you have control over me). Your Judgment upon me is assured and Your Decree concerning me is just. I ask You by every Name that You have named Yourself with, revealed in Your Book, taught any one of Your creation or kept unto Yourself in the knowledge of the unseen that is with You, to make the Qur'an the spring of my heart, and the light of my chest, the banisher of my sadness and the reliever of my distress. [1]
sub_title.duay_hadis: Abdullah ibn Mas’ud (RA) said, The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said, “If anyone afflicted with anxiety, inquietude state and he says the above mentioned dua, then Allah will remove his distress and anxiety and altered it with happiness. Companions then said, ”So, we have to learn these words! He said,“Obviously! Whomsoever listens to these words, should memorize them.” This hadith's chain of narration is acceptable. [2] N.B. Women should say this dua like this: “Allaahumma inni amatuka, wa bintu ‘abdika wa bintu amatika….” Meaning: “Oh Allah! I am your slave girl, a daughter of your slave and a daughter of your slave girl….” In many hadiths, it is encouraged to make dua by the greatest name of Allah. In many narrations, it is said that if anyone ask Allah by this name then Allah will accept his dua.
sub_title.reference: [1] Ahmad 1/391, and Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahihah 1/337 [2] Sahih Ibn Hibban 3/253

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنِّي أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اَللَّهُ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ الْأَحَدُ الصَّمَدُ اَلَّذِي لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُوْلَدْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma 'innee 'as'aluka bi'anni 'ash-hadu 'annaka 'AntAllahu laa 'ilaaha 'illaa 'Antal-'Ahadus-Samadul-ladhee lam yalid wa lam youlad wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan 'Ahad
sub_title.translation: O Allah, I ask You, by the fact that I bear witness that You are Allah. There is none worthy of worship but You, the Only God, Independent of creation, Who was not begotten and begets not , and none is equal to Him.
sub_title.duay_hadis: Buraidah (RA) said, “The Prophet (ﷺ) heard a man supplicating with this dua, So he said: ‘By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, he has asked Allah by His Greatest Name, the one which if He is called upon by it, He responds, and when He is asked by it, He gives.

sub_title.duay_arbi: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِأَنَّ لَكَ الْحَمْدَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ الْمَنَّانُ بَدِيعُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ، يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ، يَا حَيُّ يَا قَيُّومُ، إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ
sub_title.transliteration: Allaahumma inni as'aluka bi-anna lakal-hamda, laa ilaaha illaa antal-mannaanu badi'us-samaawaati wal-ardi, yaa dhal-jalaali wal-ikraam! Yaa ‘hayyu yaa qayyum inni as aluk
sub_title.translation: O Allah, indeed I ask You since all praise is due to You, there is none worthy of worship but You, the Bestower, the Creator of the heavens and earth, O Possessor of majesty and honor, O Ever-living, O-Eternal. I am asking to you.
sub_title.duay_hadis: I was sitting with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and a man was praying. When he bowed, prostrated and recited the tashahhud, he supplicated, and in his supplication he said: (the above mentioned dua). The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Do you know what he has supplicated with?' They said, Allah (SWT) and His Messenger know best. He said, 'By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, he called upon Allah by His greatest Name, which, if He is called by it, He responds, and if He is asked by it, He gives.'

sub_title.duay_title: The greatest name of Allah #3 (Du'a Yunus)
